Description:
The Surface Combat Systems' Training Command (SCSTC) domain consists of the Command Staff located in Dahlgren, VA, SCSTC Units, Sites, and Detachments worldwide. Training locations also include Shipyards, Fleet Surface Ships and Forward Deployed Naval Forces (FDNF). Services to be provided consist of Systems Engineering and Training Analysis services in support of the following areas: Manpower and Personnel, Infrastructure Support, Functional Integration Management (FIM) Support, Training Management Support, Documentation Support, Training Systems Acquisition and Lifecycle Support and International Programs (IP) Support to the Japanese Maritime Self Defense Force, Spanish, South Korea, Norwegian, Australian, Singapore Foreign Military Sales and future IP Initiatives.
The Data Analyst supports our customer by contributing to the delivery of the following services:
Accessing CeTARS and Standard Training Activity Support System (STASS) files, reviewing files, analyzing, and preparing reports, and providing recommendations for changes to course schedules based on their findings.
Ensuring Navy Training Management Databases are current by reviewing, updating, performing Quality Assurance, and establish or delete Course Identification Number (CIN), Course Data Processing (CDP) Code, and Catalog of Navy Training Courses (CANTRAC) entries.
Providing weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports utilizing CeTARS.
Inputting yearly class schedules in CeTARS for all CSCS schoolhouses, collaborates with all CSCS schoolhouses and all TSCs/Training Support Detachments (TSDs) to provide seats, change schedule dates, cancel classes, and ensure scheduled classes are cancelled and/or students are enrolled/graduated on time, per direction from the CSCS Training Directorate. T
Maintaining the test bank for all courseware utilizing an approved Naval Education Training Command (NETC) software program such as Questionmark Perception and CeTARS (or its successor) and validating the course test plan and providing test item analysis of courses taught at CSCS.
Providing CeTARS and CeTARS Subsystems training including Corporate and Student, Classroom Support Management (CSM), Student Training Management (STM), and Classroom Event Resource Scheduling (CERS), and CeTARS Resource Monitor for all CSCS personnel through onsite, distance learning and short help sessions
Modifying user accounts and terminating access for users who are no longer assigned. The Data Analyst shall provide Questionmark Perception (or its successor) training as required to all CSCS schoolhouses.
Providing technical support to CSCS. This effort includes but is not limited to development, maintenance and support of the following processes and CSCS directed functions: Training Activity Assessment Program visits, Training Project Plan reviews (providing written change recommendations), Position Mapping (jointly with CSCS N1/N7), Program Objective Memorandum and Feasibility Study analyses (including support for the data collection and analysis to identify and prioritize billets, training devices and facility requirements) Demand Signal Planning, TPM surge analyses, capacity determinations, and research, analysis, and reporting of various training metrics.
Providing updates and delivering Weekly, Monthly, and Quarterly CSCS Corporate enterprise Training Activity Resource System (CeTARS) Status Reports to CSCS N7 staff and CSCS Training Sites, to provide data analyses and administrative support for the CeTARS (STASS and NITRAS II) database, including account access controls and user support services.
Supporting CSCS Electronic Classroom courseware database(s) through analysis, testing, and assisting the instructors.
Documenting and report any changes, maintaining communications with facilitators and providing e system analyses that address software, hardware, and courseware technical issues
A day in the life of the Data Analyst -
Working within a high functioning collaborative team comprised of highly skilled coworkers and customer technical leads, and supervisors, the data analyst develops and executes delivery schedules to meet customer demand signals for the services described above.
Requirements:
Qualifications:
Three (3) years’ experience reviewing, updating, and evaluating Navy Training Management corporate database systems such as CeTARS and FLTMPS.
Must have ability to analyze data and detect trends as well as summarize findings, draw conclusions, and put together presentations.
Demonstrated experience in the annual review of training requirements in support of the Program Objective Memorandum (POM) process.
Additional Requirements:
We are looking for a teammate, so we highly value the ability to communicate and meet personal commitments not only to our customer but also our coworkers!

High School Graduate

Job Description

Intel is an industry leader and a catalyst for technology innovation and products that revolutionize the way we live. Our purpose is to create world-changing technology that improves the life of every person on the planet. Intel is in the midst of a transformational journey to deliver on its ambitious IDM 2.0 strategy which includes significant manufacturing expansions and the creation of a foundry to serve internal and external customers. This position is critical in our overall ERP transformation supporting three key businesses involved in IDM 2.0; Manufacturing, Technology Development (TD), and Intel Foundry Services (IFS), collectively referred to as TMGF.
This position is focused on TMGf's Forecast to Stock Tower as part of the IAO Program. Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:
Works with partners to support data analysis, data modeling, metadata, and data quality activities.
Uses methodologies, such as data mining and analysis, to understand current business states to contribute to change in support of Intel's IDM2.0 vision.
Builds data simulations to demonstrate current states and/or possible futures.
Constructs new datasets for consuming solutions which are considering required change.
Provides metrics and reporting support to data management and data governance efforts.
Makes recommendations for correcting or preventing errors and defects resulting from the data or ecosystem.
Designs and creates reports/dashboards to help the business in their decision making.
Creates business insights and advocates for improvements.
Communicates information to program teams and management.
The Candidate Should Exhibit the Following Behavioral Traits:
Professional verbal and written communication skills.
Must be a thinker and hands-on resulting in self-starter activities and contributing to forging the path ahead.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications are required to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.
Minimum Qualifications:
1+ years’ experience regarding Master Data supporting SAP ERP, and/or Product Data Management/Product Lifecycle Management
Demonstrated experience performing basic SQL queries (or the likes) to facilitate faster data analysis and data mining.
2+ years of experience in enterprise data modeling, data quality and architecture
2+ Years of Data Integration experience working on Supply Chain Planning, experience with ERP and Manufacturing Systems is a plus
Preferred Qualifications:
Deep knowledge of Intel's current Master Data domains such as Location or Product.
Knowledge of Supply Chain's Supply Planning ecosystem including SPAN, OneMPS, CIBR, SAP Hana.
Data simulation experience to create new data which can be seen and interacted with using Python, MATLAB, or the like.
Knowledge of Intel's current SAP backbone and/or SAP S4.
Ability and willingness to create documentation including spec-like documents and/or business process documents.
Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research.

Inside this Business Group

As the world's largest chip manufacturer, Intel strives to make every facet of semiconductor manufacturing state-of-the-art - from semiconductor process development and manufacturing, through yield improvement to packaging, final test and optimization, and world class Supply Chain and facilities support. Employees in the Technology Development and Manufacturing Group are part of a worldwide network of design, development, manufacturing, and assembly/test facilities, all focused on utilizing the power of Moore’s Law to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth.

US, NM, Albuquerque; US, OR, Hillsboro; US, CA, Folsom; US, CA, Santa Clara

Job Title: Data Analytics Engineer - Hybrid - Nashville, TN Area
Job Description:
COMPANY SUMMARY:
To achieve and maintain our high-quality standards, we seek to partner with physicians and staff who share our vision, values and brand promises and are dedicated to advancing our culture. QualDerm providers and staff are well-trained, highly skilled and recognized as leaders in the specialty of dermatology. We currently have 158 practices in 17 states, spanning across the full spectrum of dermatology, skin cancer care, cosmetics, plastic surgery, and pathology with continued plans to expand further across the nation. We will partner with you to establish the best combination of environment, technology, teamwork and personal reward opportunities to earn your confidence that we are your best place to work.
PURPOSE:
Data Analytics Engineer is responsible for both maintaining and evolving the data platform (pipelines, models, etc.) as well as dashboard and report creation and data analysis. This position is instrumental in the development and tracking of KPIs and business metrics by leveraging internal and external data sources and utilizing visualization and reporting tools. This position is responsible for both the technical aspects of the data platform and data analysis and visualization.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Help build analytics solutions focused on answering critical business questions to help inform business decisions and drive operational efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and refine the data requirements, and design/develop data deliverables.
Design, build and optimize the platform, ETL data pipelines for efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading from various sources while ensuring data quality and integrity.
Develop, and maintain reports, dashboards and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports and graphics to illustrate facts, trends, and insights.
Develop and foster relationships with internal/external partners to manage work-streams and cross-functional deliverables.
Support ad hoc data analysis projects and tasks as needed.
Identify areas to increase efficiency and process automation.
Partner with senior leaders to ensure data governance. Develops stakeholder trust in data accuracy and cleanliness.
Learn the business quickly.
OTHER FUNCTIONS:
Maintains regular and predictable attendance.
Performs other essential duties as assigned.
Maintain professional licensure/certifications as applicable.
Travel to other jobs or office locations as applicable.
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Knowledge of medical practice and care.
Knowledge of common safety hazards and precautions.
Skilled in identifying and resolving problems.
Ability to maintain records.
Ability to interpret, adapt and apply guidelines and procedures.
Ability to multitask in a busy office with numerous interruptions.
Ability to use good reasoning and judgment and react calmly in emergency situations.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with teammates.
Ability to read, write and communicate effectively orally and in writing to English.
Proficiency in the operation of a computer keyboard and ability to work effectively with Microsoft Office Products.
EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor Degree in related field
2-4 years of previous experience as a data analyst, data engineer, or business analyst.
Azure, Synapse, PowerBI (Microsoft) technology and infrastructure experience.
Experience in data management disciplines including data integration, modeling, optimization and data quality, and/or other areas directly relevant to data engineering responsibilities and tasks.
Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in support of data management and analytics initiatives.
Experience in healthcare a plus.
PHYSICAL ABILITIES:
Sit for extended periods of time; push, pull and reach; occasionally bend, sit, stoop and stretch.
Have full range of body motion, including handling and lifting of patients.
Have the hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity needed to operate a keyboard, photocopier, telephone, calculator and medical equipment.
Have a normal range of hearing and eyesight to record, prepare and communicate appropriate reports; specific vision requirements: close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to focus.
Occasionally lift and carry up to 20 pounds.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
The work of this position is performed in an environmentally controlled office environment. The position requires the ability to work under pressure and with a diverse population, including many departments and key staff members.
WORK CONDITIONS:
Normal business hours are 8a – 5p Monday-Friday, but schedules may vary in accordance with business necessity. The Company considers a consistently positive, cooperative, self-motivated, courteous and professional attitude to be an essential function of every position. While different positions have different primary areas of responsibility, everyone needs to work as a team and we expect all employees to roll up their sleeves and pitch in as necessary to get the job done.
Employees must be able to relate to other people beyond giving and receiving instructions: (a) can get along with co-workers or peers without exhibiting behavioral extremes, (b) perform work activities requiring negotiating, instructing, supervising, persuading or speaking with others; and (c) respond appropriately to constructive feedback from a supervisor.
COMPETENCIES:
To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
Use of Technology - Demonstrates required skills; adapts to new technologies.
Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner.
Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; responds promptly to customer needs; solicits customer feedback to improve service; responds to requests for service and assistance; meets commitments.
Communications - Expresses ideas and thoughts verbally; expresses ideas and thoughts in written form; exhibits good listening and comprehension.
Cooperation - Establishes and maintains effective relations; exhibits tact and consideration; offers assistance and support to co-workers.
Oral Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; responds well to questions.
Teamwork - Gives and welcomes feedback; contributes to building a positive team spirit; able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; supports everyone's efforts to succeed.
Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively.
Conflict Resolution - Keeps emotions under control.
Diversity - Shows respect and sensitivity for cultural differences.
Ethics - Treats people with respect; keeps commitments; inspires the trust of others; works with integrity and principles; upholds organizational values.
Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment.
Personal Appearance - Dresses appropriately for position; keeps self well groomed.
Attendance/Punctuality - Is consistently at work and on time; ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent; arrives at meetings and appointments on time.
Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; takes responsibility for own actions; keeps commitments; completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.
Initiative - Volunteers readily; asks for and offers help when needed.
Planning/Organizing - Uses time efficiently.
Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness.
Quantity - Meets productivity standards; completes work in timely manner.
Safety and Security - Observes safety and security procedures.
While this job description is intended to be an accurate reflection of the requirements of the job, management reserves the right to add or remove duties from particular jobs when circumstances (e.g., emergencies, changes in workload, rush jobs or technological developments) dictate. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer.

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst, Product Growth Analytics (Fully Remote)
Job Description:
LTK's mission is to empower the world's premium lifestyle Creators to achieve maximum economic success. We have a huge opportunity ahead of us and we're looking for team members who want to create, innovate and disrupt an industry.
We empower our team members to drive innovation, create value, and continue to spearhead the creation of this industry — a game changer when it comes to career growth.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Product Growth Analytics
Location: This is a fully remote position. If you are located near one of our LTK offices, come have a coffee when you want to socialize!
About the role:
LTK's Insights & Analytics team is an integral component of the company's overall mission. As a Senior Product Data Analyst, you will work cross-functionally across LTK to provide insights to optimize the business and assess the execution of and impact of initiatives.
In this role, you will be part of a growth-hungry, acceleration-minded team of problem-solvers and product-builders; you will use a data-driven approach to drive a deep understanding of our rapidly evolving business and platforms.
At LTK, we focus relentlessly on the needs of our influencers and consumers. We seek thought-partners and creative thinkers who can collaborate effectively with product managers, marketing managers, designers, and engineers to define and measure success metrics as well as identify actionable insights to help LTK grow.
How you will make an impact
Be a champion of data throughout the organization through the creation of standardized metrics, intuitive dashboards, and compelling business insights
Be able to extract data out of Big Data technologies (i.e. Redshift) to produce clear and actionable insights
Synthesize complex data analyses and communicate clearly and effectively to stakeholders across the organization, such as the exploration and analysis of user behaviors (segmentation), LTV modeling, and churn analysis, as examples, to drive actionable insights
Identify opportunities most important for growth to remove barriers for product adoption, retention, engagement and partner with growth-focused teams (product, engineering, marketing) to execute on projects
Understand funnels, ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trends in the adoption of our products for both creators & consumers to identity (and influence) opportunities for step-changes
Craft compelling dashboards and visualizations to "tell the story" of the business
Continually evaluate and refine your technical toolkit; teach what you learn to the team
Thrive and excel in tackling ambiguous problems and showcasing creative and innovative solutions
Approach problems with various degrees of agility and focus on output you are solutions and results oriented and strive to empower peers, stakeholders, and leaders
Apply common statistical methods, data modeling, and predictive analysis to answer strategic questions for the business
What you will bring to LTK
3+ years experience as an analyst or in a quantitative role
A self-starter with a passion for data; you "think outside the box" and "around the corner" with fierce attention to detail
Innately curious and have a strong desire to discover impactful insights from data to drive the business
Proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation to drive actionable insights and decisions
Strong communication skills - you can present your findings in a clear and articulate way to groups of various stakeholders to drive decision making
A deep desire to prove yourself right or wrong and make smart decisions without ego
Empathy and intellectual humility to build strong rapport and thought-partnerships with colleagues
Ability to thrive and adapt in a fast-paced, high-growth, and rapidly changing environment
Ability to think short-term and long-term and pivot across multiple projects and manage various stakeholders
Excellent ability to compartmentalize and manage queues, prioritization, and effectively manage up
Strong SQL skills and focus on optimization, refinement, and scalability; experience with Python, R or a similar programming language is a plus
Proficiency with BI visualization tool (i.e. Looker, Tableau)
Functional requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's degree; your major can be anything - we love diverse educational backgrounds, but you have a strong quantitative foundation
Demonstrable record of professional and academic achievements

The opportunity to be part of the leading global company in creator commerce
A remote-first, productivity-first environment
Competitive compensation and benefits package to meet the needs of you and your family
401(k) with LTK matching
Wellness reimbursement

About LTK
Founded in 2011, LTK is the global technology platform purpose-built to empower lifestyle creators to monetize their content. The full-service platform connects brands, creators, and shoppers with a world-class shopping app and trusted tools and technology that make content instantly shoppable. Today, premium lifestyle creators in 150+ countries drive more than $3.6 billion in annual retail sales through their LTK Shop profiles. More than 20 million consumers turn to LTK Shops in the LTK shopping platform each month to find inspiration and instantly shop the styles recommended by their favorite creators. And, more than 6,000 brands partner with LTK to gain access to its global creator network for content that converts against performance-driven, cross-channel KPIs. LTK is headquartered in Dallas, TX, and currently operates on five continents.
Our mission
To empower the world's premium lifestyle Creators to achieve maximum economic success.
Our values
Be a team player
Make an impact
Bring on the fun
Commitment to diversity
LTK believes diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental obligations that strengthen our team. We employ a diverse, multi-disciplinary team to build a meaningful company and culture.

The Reporting and Data Analyst will conduct Contact Center assessment of Helpline performance against its strategic plan by collecting, processing, reporting and analyzing data and communicating results.
Responsibilities
Essential functions and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Data Processing:
Collect, compile, and clean data from a variety of sources in an accurate and timely manner.
Create/edit excel templates for data collection and analysis.
Documents reporting requirements and processes and validates data components as required.
Perform quality controls, locate inconsistencies in data, and communicate with national and chapter colleagues to resolve issues.
Assists with gathering requirements for future requests of reports.
Leads operational meetings with insights from reports.
Data Reports:
Extracts and analyzes data from various sources, including NICE CX1, Personify CRM and other systems, manual files, and external websites.
Generates and deliver timely operational reports. This includes daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reports for call volume and service level for the contact center. Prepares special reports as requested; generates reports and visual displays of data. This also include weekly, quarterly and annual chapter level data as well as agent performance data.
Responds to data inquiries from Chapters and other groups within organization with accurate and timely data.
System Maintenance:
Determines and makes recommendations for database design, sources of data, process design, data collection/processing and data cleansing.
Maintains central repositories of all Helpline and Contact Center data collection and reports.
Manages changes to reporting systems and maintains effective data collection protocols.
Creates new tables, queries, and reports to handle special data requests in a timely manner.
Imports and merges data from multiple sources into new and existing data repositories.
Maintains google sheets, CX1 and other excel reports/reference files.
Performs other duties as assigned
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in business or social science field required, Master’s preferred.
Two years of applicable work experience.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel. Knowledge of Tableau Software, MS BI and Access preferred (knowing formulas, pivot tables and creating reports from raw data).
Experience with data analysis and report writing skills.
Ability to think independently and proactively
Ability to learn new software, systems, and processes, and train other staff in their usage
Must be detail-oriented and have the ability to review data for errors and analyze data
Must be able to multi-task and work on several different projects throughout the day
Must possess excellent organizational skills and meet deadlines
Must possess analytical skills, with the ability to research, compile, analyze, report, and present data findings
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Experience with extracting data from NICE CX1 Suite.
Experience with extracting data from CRMs (Personify is a plus).
Familiarity with Rest APIs is a plus.
Title: Reporting and Data Analyst - Contact Center
Position Location: Remote, US - Home Office Chicago, IL
Full time based on 37.5 hours minimum
Position Grade: 505 Exempt (Estimated Annual Salary Range $48,000 - $60,000)

Who We Are:
The Alzheimer’s Association is the leading voluntary health organization in Alzheimer’s care, support and research. Our mission is to lead the way to end Alzheimer's and all other dementia- by accelerating global research, driving risk reduction and early detection, and maximizing quality care and support.
At the Alzheimer’s Association, our employees are at the core of all we do. Our network of more than 1,900 employees across the United States makes a difference each and every day for those impacted by Alzheimer’s and those at risk for the disease.
We warmly invite qualified applicants to consider this opportunity to make a life-changing impact on the millions living with Alzheimer’s, their caregivers and those that may develop the disease in the future. Read on to learn more about the role, then visit our website www.alz.org/jobs to explore who we are and why we've been recognized as a Best Place to Work for the last twelve years in a row.
At the Alzheimer's Association®, we believe that diverse perspectives are critical to achieving health equity - meaning that all communities have a fair and just opportunity for early diagnosis and access to risk reduction and quality care. The Association is committed to engaging underrepresented and underserved communities and responding with resources and education to address the disproportionate impact of Alzheimer’s and dementia.
The Alzheimer’s Association is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
Employees working 24 hours/week or more are eligible for a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, flex accounts, short and long-term disability, life insurance, long term care insurance, tuition reimbursement, generous Paid Time Off, 12 annual holidays and Paid Family Leave, as well as an annual Cultural & Heritage Day and Volunteer Day of their choosing. They are also eligible for our gold standard 401(k) retirement plan.
Full time employees (37.5 hours/week), will enjoy all of the above plus an annual School Visitation Day and an Elder Care Facility Day of their choosing.

About the role:
As a company founded by service-disabled Veterans, we at DFC are driven by a duty to serve our clients, our employees, and our community. We are committed to helping organizations achieve their goals by cultivating a team of talented professionals that deliver exceptional service, creative insights, and high-quality results.
DFC seeks an experienced Data Analyst to support a project supporting the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). The project will support VA's Enterprise Mail Management Program. This position focuses on providing support to design, develop, and deliver modern analytics tools, statistical analysis and data analytic services, and data management services.
What the role requires:
Collect, analyze, manage, and report on data from various sources and systems,
Experience with MS Access and Power BI,
Develop and implement a wide range of advanced qualitative and quantitative methods to assess and improve operational effectiveness,
Support development of data reports, including dashboards, data visualizations,
Review and present results to senior management and other end-users,
Lead data mining efforts on internal government and external public sources,
Provide viable reference material for users by writing and maintaining user documentation,
Maintain client confidence and protect operations by maintaining information confidentiality,
Be responsible for understanding large data sets and leading and managing advance data techniques in support of emerging initiatives and projects.
What you need to be successful:
At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data architecture.
Aptitude to adapt best practices to develop customized solutions for unique client needs.
Capacity to work well in team-based environment as well as independently.
Ability to lead and facilitate client meetings, conference calls, and capture accurate meeting notes.
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
Well-organized with the ability to handle several projects/clients simultaneously.
Strong analytical skills, presentation development and writing skills.
Exceptional skills in Microsoft Office Suite, including Microsoft Excel.
Strong work ethic with a commitment to client service excellence.
Strong client presence.
Experience working with VA is strongly preferred.
Other important information:
Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, science, operational research, or a related field is required
Ability to obtain a US government security clearance, if needed, is required.
Applicants must have the legal right to work in the US for any employer; sponsorship is not available for this position.
Preference will be given to qualified Veteran candidates.
Location
This opportunity is available in the Washington DC metro area (flexible work arrangement), Charlotte NC (fulltime remote), Columbia SC (fulltime remote), and Minneapolis MN (fulltime remote).

SiloSmashers, Inc. is a strategy, technology, and management consulting firm, founded in 1992, and located in Herndon, Virginia. SiloSmashers delivers superior services and solutions to the public sector in the areas of project/program management, performance management, and IT security.

USMS/POD Background Information
The USMS, a component of the Department of Justice (DOJ), has approximately 6,500 employees and support contractors located in approximately 400 offices across the United States and its territories.
The Prisoner Operations Division (POD) is one of twelve organizational divisions within the USMS with the mission to preserve the integrity of the federal judicial process by administering the federal detention management system and establishing national detention policy.
POD establishes national strategies and programs providing for the housing, transportation, and care of federal prisoners.
The BIC performs functions associated with Performance Management/Continuous Process Improvement (PM/CPI) and leverages key business functional areas to provide integration of strategic performance management across the division to optimize effectiveness.
Principal functions of the BIC involve - Data Analytics, Business Engineering, and Policy Compliance and Reporting.
Data Visualization Specialist (Tableau/Power BI)/Business Process Analyst
The Data Visualization Specialist/Business Process Analyst shall use proven Performance Management and Continuous Process Improvement (PM/CPI) methodologies to streamline processes to eliminate process waste in order to improve organizational productivity, improve access to information and decision-making, and increase the utilization of assets and resources. The Data Visualization Specialist/ Business Process Analyst shall:
Provide Data Visualization
Experience with Data analysis, data cleanup, and preparation for data visualization
Creating interactive maps using Excel spreadsheets and external databases (E.g., SharePoint)
Creating custom searchable data sets using Power BI and/or Tableau
Provide support reviewing organizational strategies, operations, and programs to improve organizational processes and performance. Associated duties include:
Conduct research and business process analysis relevant to the POD mission, goals, objectives, strategies, and functions, and then develop recommendations and plans to maximize the capability of existing programs, processes, procedures, and structures to improve access to information, eliminate process waste, and increase decision-maker awareness while minimizing risks.
Review organizational programs, documents, reports, and data for policy implications and impacts on the USMS, districts, and the federal detention management system and assist the BIC with reconciling conflicts between policies and program goals.
Develop strategies, governance, and plans supporting the transition to new operational methods and practices; including communication strategies to effectively inform and create organization and stakeholder buy-in about changes.
Identify critical internal and external issues and recommend solutions to mitigate the issues. Provide support with strategic and performance planning and reporting to ensure linkage among planning elements (i.e., mission, vision, goals, objectives, strategies, and performance management initiatives). Associated duties include:
Develop and analyze project evaluation criteria to identify the projects that provide the most benefit to POD.
Developing project plans with the integration, monitoring, and closeout supporting the strategies.
Develop and maintain processes and means to support tracking and oversight of projects to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of operations.
Support project pipeline and a project portfolio that aligns with the POD strategies and priorities.
Support tracking and manage risk to ensure projects stay on schedule.
Capture and consolidate best practices and lessons learned in order to promote the application of similar process improvement opportunities across the Detention Program.

The Data Visualization Specialist/Business Process Analyst must have:
At least 5 years' experience using Tableau and/or Power BI to create custom searching on structured data and creating interactive maps.
Data analysis and data preparation experience for mapping and customized searches.
Strong knowledge of business process analysis.
Experience in the development and interpretation of organization structures and processes.
Strong writing experience to include the development of comprehensive resolution recommendations.
Experience preparing and delivering briefs to executive leadership on performance results.

About Family Services Association:

Family Service Association is a comprehensive private, non-profit social service agency dedicated to the development and implementation of services designed to provide strength and support to individuals and families throughout southeastern Massachusetts. Headquartered in Fall River, Family Service Association strives to increase the capacity of individuals and families to cope with the stresses of family life and interpersonal relationships in a positive, productive and health-improving manner. This agency is a leading provider of professional social services in the South Coast region of Massachusetts, with a 130-year tradition of high quality.

Summary

Your analytical skills will be used to create and analyzes reports to support operations and present report findings concisely to the appropriate management level. You will also serve in a lead capacity as an expert data analyst and may also lead a team.

Here is your opportunity to apply your strong organizational, customer service, communications, and analytical skills; demonstrate your comprehensive knowledge of relevant computer support systems. And your ability to train subordinate staff, including assisting/guiding staff in the design/execution of reporting needs.

Description

Location: This role is 100% remote, working from anywhere in the US.

Review, extract, and analyze data to formulate procedures, processes, and other requirements, including data integrity and quality control.
Develop complex analysis and sophisticated data compilation, verification, and interpretations to guide divisional efforts.
Communicate with and/or trains employees and managers on the complex database programs that generate analytical data.
Monitor data to comply with applicable regulations and communicates and update data as necessary.

Required Education: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Business, Healthcare, or other related field OR Two-year degree in Computer Science, Business, or related field AND two years of reporting and data analysis work experience.
Required Work Experience: Six (6) years of research and analysis experience.
Required Software and Tools: Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office. Knowledge of programming languages across various software platforms using DB2, SQL, and/or relational databases. Knowledge of tools such as Visual Basic and Macros in automating reporting processes.
Required Skills and Abilities:
Strong organizational, customer service, communications, and analytical skills.
Advanced experience using complex mathematical calculations and understanding mathematical and statistical concepts.
Knowledge of relevant computer support systems.
Ability to train subordinate staff, including assisting/guiding staff in the design/execution of reporting needs.
Proven experience with report writing and technical requirements analysis, data and business process modeling/mapping, and methodology development.
Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.
Knowledge of the healthcare delivery system.
We Prefer That You Have The Following:
8 Years of research and analysis experience.
Knowledge of Reporting Languages: DB2, SQL, DVA.
Project Management experience.

Functioning independently and under the general direction of principal investigator, the Data Analyst performs high level, complex research activities. The candidate will work in the clinical and research areas of BWH cardiovascular disease prevention and imaging programs and will require professionalism, self-motivation, and an ability to work independently, as well as with others. The analyst may be responsible for the following activities: collecting and organizing patient data; analyzing large databases of patient data; contributing to the preparation and presentation of research results in the form of oral presentation and manuscript preparation for publications. At minimum the analyst should have some experience in data analyses and/or statistical programming and be highly motivated and able to learn new analytical skills. Ideally, qualified candidates will have advanced statistical skills, including formal training in statistics or biostatistics and experience with Stata software. Prior experience in analysis of observational and experimental studies, and strong statistical computing skills also required.

Undergraduate or graduate degree preferably in a medical/pre-medical, analytical, and/or computational field.
Minimum of 2-3 years of related experience.
Significant experience with statistical analysis using Stata, Inc.
Interest in clinical/prevention research in cardiology.

Strong interpersonal skills in order to work effectively with other team members.
Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
Excellent time management and organizational skills as well as the ability to prioritize a variety of tasks.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, including both long-term and short-term projects.
Careful attention to detail.
Experience and knowledge in STATA with experience in SAS, R, and Matlab a plus.
Working with EHR data, including epic / EWS, snowflake, and RPDR
Experience in large data sets, including SQL
Demonstrated independent judgment and competencies in clinical research.
Strong research design and analytical skills.

Air Transportation Data Analyst 1: Will demonstrate in-depth functional knowledge of AMC airlift operations and is highly proficient with utilizing GATES applications. An ideal candidate will possess over eight years of experience serving within an Aerial Port, Air Mobility Squadron, Air Transportation Function (ATF), or Contingency Response Wing (CRW) with routine exposure to manual and automated air manifesting procedures, pax service operations, anti-hijacking screening, mishandled baggage processing, and ITV systems to include- but not limited to- GATES, IGC, GDSS, e-APIS, and e-Secure Flight (eSF). An Air Transportation Data Analyst will initially possess a basic understanding of APS/AMS Data Records functions and will be trained to efficiently troubleshoot and/or resolve TWCF reconciliation requirements. An associate's or bachelor's degree is preferred, however, the OTS Team will prioritize logistics experience and/or the attendance of a 2T2/2T0 technical school. Air Transportation (2T2) subject matter expertise and intermediate computer literacy are paramount to promptly resolving manifesting, passenger vetting, workload reporting, and GATES-user issues experienced 24/7 by the global Port Dawg community.

Position Overview
Provide professional and functional subject matter expertise for operational end users in the Remote Manifesting Resolution Center (RMRC) and associated support tools for application functionality, related user productivity (e.g. optimization of workload and application utility) and end user assistance with maximizing In-transit Visibility (ITV) of real world and exercise passenger/cargo operations.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Within the RMRC, the Air Transportation Specialist will:
Maintain cargo/passenger screening and manifesting applications in support of Air Mobility Command (AMC) Aerial Ports and designated USAF operational scenarios/locations where logistics personnel do not have access to automated In-Transit Visibility (ITV) systems
Apply USAF Transportation (2TXXX) and/or global mobility Subject Matter Expertise (SME) to resolve general air manifesting, workload reporting, record keeping, and GATES-user problems experienced by the Air Transportation community
Facilitate overall process improvements for data collection, input, analysis, reconciliation, and record keeping processes for Air Terminal Records and Reporting functions world-wide
Basic Qualifications:
In-depth knowledge of USAF Aerial Port, Air Mobility, (APS/AMS) or Logistic Readiness Squadron (LRS) cargo and passenger movement operations
Proficient using the Global Air Transportation Execution System (GATES)
Familiar with In-Transit Visibility (ITV) systems that support global AMC operations
Skilled with Air Freight automated and manual manifesting requirements
Experience with Passenger Service Operations to include passenger anti-hacking/screening, manifesting, lost baggage, and Customer Identification Codes (CIC)
Knowledgeable of Over/Short Shipment Reports, Monthly Station Traffic Handling Reports, and GATES cargo/passenger queries
Understanding of Customs and Border Protection requirements for flights departing/entering the United States
Basic understanding of Transportation Working Capital Fund (TWCF) and Air transportation billing/reconciliation requirements
Desired Skills:
Familiarity with operations of all or some of the following software applications:
Global Air Transportation Execution System (GATES)
Integrated Development Environment GTN Conveyance (IGC)
Electronic Advance Passenger Information System (eAPIS)
eSecure Flight
Transportation Management System (TMS)
Defense Enterprise Accounting and Management System (DEAMS)
Distribution Component Billing System (DCBS)
Global Decision Support System (GDSS)
C2Remedy
Hyperion
Toad Data Point
Microsoft Office products
SharePoint
Education
Associates in relevant technical field or additional 2 years' experience
Secret Clearance

Job Description:
Airbus US Manufacturing Facility is looking for an Logistics Data Analyst to join our Final Assembly Line (FAL) based in Mobile, AL.
Functions as lead analyst managing a small analytics team dedicated to developing accurate and timely data and focused on providing detailed analysis for use by Final Assembly Line (FAL) Logistics Management. Analyses reflect all levels of FAL logistical operations across the entire Logistics Value Stream and includes special projects as well as transport operations and Logistics Service Provider (LSP) functions. Presents data in various visual methods and presents detailed analysis to team members and FAL leadership. Strong briefing skills required.



Meet the team:
The team at the Airbus U.S. Manufacturing facilities help assemble the finest aircraft in the world, along two (soon to be three) production lines for the A220 and A320 Family aircraft. On the shop floor you’ll be surrounded by individuals who are passionate about aviation and skilled in areas like electrical, structure and quality. Join our team and help build the next generation of aircraft.



Your working environment:
Nearby on ‘Airbus Way’ you will find the Airbus U.S. Manufacturing Facility for commercial aircraft. Opened at the Mobile Aeroplex at Brookley in 2015, the facility produces A320 Family aircraft and added a second product line for the A220 in 2019. The facility, which strengthens the U.S. aerospace industry, is part of Airbus’ strategy to enhance its global competitiveness by meeting the growing needs of its customers in the United States and beyond.


How we care for you :
Financial Rewards: Competitive base salary, incentive compensation which may include profit sharing schemes, retirement savings plan and the ability to participate in an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (“ESOP”)
Work/Life Balance: Paid time off including personal time, holidays and a generous paid parental leave program.
Health & Welfare: Comprehensive insurance coverage including medical (traditional and high-deductible health plans), prescription, dental, vision, life, disability, Employee Assistance Plan (“EAP”) and other supplemental benefit coverages.
Individual Development: Upskilling and development opportunities through our global Leadership University, including unlimited access to 10,000+ e-learning courses focusing on ways to develop your employability, certifications, career path as well as the opportunity to participate in accelerated development programmes and both national and international mobility.


At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and accessibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.



Your challenges:

Identifies logistical issues and designs data collection models and methods to analyze problems from all directions and at all levels.
Applies a variety of tools to collect, analyze and report data. Provides substantive and meaningful insight and interpretation of data, root cause analysis and protection follow on actions/improvement actions.
Performs sophisticated analysis of the data and prepares standardized reports on logistical matters such as Safety, Quality, Cost, Delivery, Personnel as well as ad hoc reports using standardized and specifically collected data and reports.
Undertakes projects specifically targeted to identify root causes of logistical and organizational issues. Collects relevant data and makes specific recommendations for remediation. Organizes multi-functional teams with other FAL representatives to potentially address/achieve global improvements.
Utilizes data resulting from special projects to develop useful and timely recommendations to the logistics leadership team to resolve issues and improve logistical operations.
Organizes presentations, reports and training on a regular basis to achieve well-informed logistics management throughout the FAL. Makes presentations on matters of general interest. Promotes problem-solving activities throughout the FAL.
Supports leadership and the team when needed on general administrative tasks including, calendar management, and admin support of SQCDP and visual management boards,
Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends.
Performs other duties as assigned.




Your boarding pass:
A Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain & Logistics, Business Administration, Data Analytics or equivalent experience is required.
Minimum 5 years of experience in operational analysis, organizational engineering or production management.
Demonstrable knowledge of Lean Methods and processes. Experience in Lean activities is preferred.
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data.
Demonstrable skill in distilling information and drawing accurate and succinct conclusions from technical as well as anecdotal and historical data.
High level of communications skills both oral and written is expected.
Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations.
SAP experience required
Advanced level with Microsoft Excel


Not a 100% match? No worries! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions.

Take your career to a new level and apply online now!

Job Title: Capital Markets and Financial Industry Data Analyst
Job Description:
Position Description
This position is responsible for liquidity risk analysis and financial market analysis. The location is in DC, SEC headquarters. Onsite. Full time. Compensation $140K-200K/year (including bonus) + benefits. It is not a government job. It is a position of a private consulting firm but the client is the government agency SEC. Require Green Card or Citizenship. Public trust clearance is required before hiring.

Duties
performing financial analysis and building advanced financial models to analyze security market data and assess the liquidity of the assets and portfolios. performing analysis of the financial markets, securities, and related financial data. processing financial data and managing databases;

Qualifications

shall have a minimum of 7 years data analysis experience in capital markets/financial industry or economic analysis, with deep expertise in financial market-related topics such as hedge funds, options, credit default swaps, mortgage backed securities, or municipal securities. The Capital Markets and Financial Industry Data Analyst shall have knowledge of statistical methods, mathematical techniques, computer software and algorithms that are commonly applied in these areas. A Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, or Mathematics is essential. An MBA or MFE is desired. The candidate shall demonstrate the ability to communicate effectively with financial economists, or other quantitative analysts and programmers and possess a broad knowledge of hardware/software technologies.

If you are interested in the position, please send us an email at contact@digitcompass.com with your resume and cover letter. Thank you!

Job Description
Overview:
Citadel is focused on acquiring, cleaning, and analyzing large, unstructured data sets to generate new insights. Given the vast amount of data being produced, Citadel is implementing new research methodologies to identify significant trends. The Sector Data Analytics group within Citadel Global Equities is committed to generating sustained alpha using a scientific approach to generate fundamental investment insights.
Responsibilities Include:
Coordinate with investment teams to understand their investment approach, and how data can support their research processes

Assist investment teams in understanding the key data drivers of companies and sectors

Analyze data from multiple sources to test complex investment theses

Quickly digest data, recognize inflection points, and determine data relevancy to the investment question at hand

Deliver high quality research to investment teams in a clear and digestible manner

Work with existing and new data sets to push significant ideas and decision support tools to investment teams

Required Attributes:
Intellectual curiosity with a genuine interest in investment

Professional demeanor, a capability to learn, think, and react quickly, along with exceptional communication and presentation skills as required for interaction with investment teams

Ability to consume sell side reports, understand fundamental investment theses & identify crucial data points

Creativity/ability to innovate, combined with a strong work ethic and organizational skills to efficiently handle demanding workload

Self-reliant and possessing good common sense

Comfort identifying, analyzing, and presenting novel data that is unique and useful

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in statistics, engineering, economics, business, computer science, or physics

Advanced degree a plus, as are degrees spanning multiple disciplines

CFA or similar qualification a plus

Location:
New York, Chicago, San Francisco
Required Skills
Advanced knowledge of Python (including Pandas) and SQL

Strong background in statistical modelling

Strong analytical and quantitative skills

Experience working with large, unstructured data sets

Preferred

Full Time Opportunity
General Description
The Data Analyst designs and executes data mining plans, performs primary and secondary analyses, prepares reports, and conducts research & presentations of moderate difficulty on a wide range of projects. Tasks typically involve quantitative analysis, data integration from both internal & external sources and database development. It also involves market research project coordination.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Performs data mining and analyze large sets of data to identify patterns and trends by applying quantitative and analytical tools. Ensures data quality by performing segmentation, applicable policies, and accuracy audits.
Pinpoints trends, correlations, and patterns in complicated data sets.
Regularly review and assess condition of retail lending portfolios and develop and implement credit policies and monitoring procedures to maintain credit risk exposure within acceptable parameters.
Monitor and assess the post-implementation impact of risk management strategies.
Identifies methods and procedures for obtaining, maintaining, and updating customer related data, including the collection, coding, and tabulation. Leads the evaluation of the data as well as the database development and maintenance or relational database and data system.
Uses statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful reports. For example, customer profiles and response analyses.
Develops analysis and recurrent reports for management and internal clients, presenting the results of research and analysis. Provides concise data reports and clear data visualizations for management.
Helps facilitate processes to translate data insights into strategic direction.
Supports integration of credit risk models previously developed into database process and analyses.
Make recommendations of credit policies adjustments and portfolio management strategies based on the results of the analysis made.
Works with management and staff to ensure understanding and implementation of applicable policies/guidelines, automation systems and procedures.
Maintain consistent open communication and develop strong relationships with credit underwriting units.
Manages projects as assigned.
Performs related duties and responsibilities required.
Education
Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) in Industrial Engineering, Computer Science or Economics, Statistics or Mathematics
Experience
Two (2) years of experience in data mining, research, market analysis and/or data management, financial analysis or other related fields.
Other Qualifications
Knowledge of and ability to design database analyses.
Knowledge of and ability to perform quantitative analysis.
Working knowledge of data management, including database and spreadsheet applications, with the ability to use moderately complex models or specialized computer applications.
Advanced statistical analysis skills. Specifically, ability to apply advanced analysis methodologies, interpret and present findings in a clear, concise manner, including the creation and use of tables, charts and graphics to summarize results.
Proficient in statistical programs like SAS, SPSS, R and / or data processing tools like SQL, Power Pivot, FoxPro and Cognos. (preferable)
Ability to evaluate design, analysis and conclusions based on database information.
Ability to prepare clear and comprehensive reports.
Ability to make sound decisions in a consistent manner with essential job functions.
Excellent oral and communication skills, both in English and Spanish.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Certifications on Data Science, Analytics and/or Data Management is a plus
Important: The candidate must provide evidence of academic preparation or courses related to the job posting.

Overview:
Western Dental Services, Inc., California’s largest dental services provider and one of the nation’s largest dental HMO’s, is looking for a bright, motivated, seasoned data analyst. This position will be based at our Corporate Headquarters in Orange, CA. As a Data Analyst you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data sets to uncover insights and drive data-informed decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, data scientists, and IT professionals, to ensure accurate data analysis and reporting. The ideal candidate has a strong analytical mindset, extensive experience in data analysis, and a proven ability to derive actionable recommendations from data.

Responsibilities:
Data Analysis and Interpretation:
Collect, cleanse, and transform large and complex data sets to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Conduct advanced statistical analysis, data mining, and modeling to identify patterns, trends, and insights.
Interpret data and communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, including data visualizations, reports, and presentations.
Data-Driven Insights:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and provide data-driven insights and recommendations.
Identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop metrics to track and measure business performance.
Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement, cost reduction, and revenue enhancement based on data analysis.
Data Quality and Integrity:
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through data validation, quality checks, and adherence to data governance policies.
Work closely with IT teams to optimize data extraction, transformation, and loading processes.
Perform data profiling and data cleansing activities to improve data quality.
Tools and Technology:
Utilize a variety of tools and technologies for data analysis, such as SQL, Python, R, Excel, Tableau, or other data visualization and analytics platforms.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in data analysis techniques and tools and identify opportunities to leverage new technologies.
Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, data scientists, and IT professionals, to align data analysis initiatives with organizational goals.
Provide guidance and mentorship to junior data analysts, sharing best practices and fostering a data-driven culture.
Data Standards and Policies:
Enforce data standards, naming conventions, and data management best practices.
Maintain data policies and procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
Qualifications:
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a track record of delivering impactful data-driven insights and recommendations.
Strong proficiency in data analysis techniques, statistical methods, and data visualization tools.
Expertise in SQL for data extraction and manipulation, and programming languages such as Python or R for advanced analysis.
Experience with data visualization tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms, to create interactive dashboards and reports.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex data sets and derive actionable recommendations.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with shifting priorities and multiple concurrent projects.
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and quality.
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field, such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 3 years of experience in IT, Software Engineering or Statistical Data Analysis
Preference will be given to candidates with healthcare industry experience.
Join our team as a Seasoned Data Analyst and contribute to data-driven decision-making that shapes our organization's success. Apply now and help us unlock the power of data for strategic insights.

We are the people behind the people who keep saving lives.

Overview:
The Department of Veterans Affairs Network Operations Center (NOC) defends, manages, and monitors the network operating status and cyber security posture of the VA by providing the day-to-day management, monitoring, operations, and configuration of the Trusted Internet Connection (TIC) Gateways, the delivery of enterprise security systems and services, the conduct of threat and vulnerability analysis, the validation of adequate security controls within the enterprise, and the full range of functions across the spectrum of activities relating to incident management, incident response and enterprise network management.
Company/Position Overview (Please include a day in the life description of what the candidate will be doing day to day and how their role is a part of the overall project):
Business Analyst Team: responsible for supporting, maintaining and, managing the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Enterprise Wide Area Network (WAN) through Capacity Management and Planning, Circuit Provisioning requests, Invoice reviews, and Mobility Services.


Responsible for maintaining and managing the Enterprise WAN (2500+ sites) by analyzing and reporting on circuit utilization to forecast/project WAN growth for the enterprise.


Participate in the review and analysis of existing network configurations in support of engineering to ensure that existing network methodologies and processes are compliant with One VA Enterprise Architecture (EA) requirements.
Contribute to the planning, tracking and analysis of multiple projects through reporting detailed information, analyzing data in support of project cost/schedule status and following established procedures while contributing to the completion of circuit provisioning requests.
Responsible for reviewing the enterprise invoices for multiple vendors to verify monthly costs, identify and initiate disputes, and make payment recommendations on purchase orders.

Support the VA Mobility Team by facilitating order requests, managing return request agreements, directing emergency requests to the correct contacts, and preparing status reports for vendors.

Will directly communicate with Project Managers, Contract Management staff, Senior Engineering/Technical personnel, as well as other VA employees.

Manage specified project objectives, project constraints (scope, schedule, cost, quality, etc.), project risk, and coordinate with project manager and other resources as needed.

Assist with the development of standard operating procedures to establish compliance with the operational practices of the organization.

Knowledge/experience with Microsoft Power BI data analytics tool
Mandatory Qualifications (Please list all Education, Certifications, Experience, Skills that are Required to get an interview. These mandatory qualifications should be non-negotiable based on your contract requirements)
Education / Experience: Bachelors with 0-2 years of experience. 4 years of additional experience may be substituted for education
PWS Specified Certifications: This position requires privileged system access. The applicant shall have six months to obtain an industry standard certification.
Miscellaneous: Duties may require traveling, being on call periodically, and occasionally working outside normal working hours (evenings and weekends)
Background Investigation: Must be able to pass a government Tier 4 High Background Investigation
Desired Qualifications (Please list all Education, Certifications, Experience, and Skills that are desired. These should not be disqualifiers, but rather nice to haves):
Competency: Complete assignments of moderate complexity on time within a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. The ability to quickly learn new process tools, multi-task, analyze, and communicate effectively. Must possess professional writing and communication skills.
Knowledge: Business process and acquisition support. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft office suite including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and SharePoint. The ability to operate and maintain asset management databases.
Problem Solving: Create courses of action and proactively solve problems by conducting research, conceiving, and developing new and innovative ideas, theories, and/or solutions, and predicting possible outcomes. Possess the ability to prepare and present "what-if" scenarios.
Supervision: Ability to operate independently and/or with a team to effectively deliver government directed projects.
Miscellaneous: Experience within the VA and Government agencies supporting Program/Project Managers; VA infrastructure experience is a plus. Career driven and willing to grow in a professional environment is desired.

Position Description :
Are you a Data Analyst looking for an opportunity to make an impact every day? Serco has a great opportunity for you to take a role as part of the Global Logistics Augmentation and Staff Support (GLASS) team in supporting the Army Sustainment Command at Rock Island, IL.

Join an integrated government-industry team in support of multiple program functions. Specific tasks include the following: Operations and Plans, Desk Officer, ORSA, Training and Exercise, Automation/Database Management and Cost Management Support Services.

You will provide a wide range of customer requirements in the Army supply systems and operations. Use your expertise and collaborative skills to positively impact our national defense and make a difference in the world’s greatest Army.

In this role, you will:
Provide quantitative and qualitative analytical capabilities in advanced methodological approaches, and advanced business process optimization across the Doctrine, Organization, Training, Materiel, Leadership, Education, Personnel, Facilities and Policy (DOTMLPF-P) spectrum and beyond.
Effectively identify complex challenges and opportunities within Army Sustainment Command (ASC) systems.
Development of comprehensive solutions and incorporating these capability solutions into ASC’s software and workflows
Qualifications:
To be successful in this role, you will have:
An Associates degree and 4+ years relevant experience
or Bachelor's Degree and 2+ years of relevant experience
Experience with Computer programming
Knowledge of R programming language and R Studio Integrated development environment to create well documented scripts in R programming language to process and create reports
The ability to obtain and maintain an active interim Secret clearance
The ability to successfully complete a NACI Background check
Ability to travel up to 10% of the time as needed
Additional desired experience and skills:
Knowledge of DOTMLPF-P framework
Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL)
Ability to create/maintain interfaces with the purpose of tracking equipment and streamlining the Army’s shipping process using the following systems: Integrated Booking System (IBS), Global Freight Management (GFM), Cargo Movement Operations System (CMOS), Distribution Standard System (DSS), and Financial Air Clearance Transportation System (FACTS); Electronic Transportation Acquisition (ETA) systems: Business Support and Container Management (BSCM), SDDC C4 Systems (ISDDC); Billing systems: Syncada, Transportation Financial Management System (TFMS). Integrated Data Environment (IDE)/Global Transportation Network (GTN) Convergence (IGC). USTRANSCOM’s Single Mobility System (SMS)
Ability to develop a method of tracking approved Funds Verification and Use Authorizations (FVUAs) throughout the entire shipping process.

Excellent communication, analytics, presentation, and teamwork skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skill set

As part of team Jacobs, you will work with the client to understand the information requirements, as you leverage the data environment to develop answers and solutions for decision making on real-world missions. You will use various analytic platforms and manage cloud services to build scalable data pipelines to extract insights by leveraging open-source data and tools. You will integrate into a cross-functional team of data scientists, software engineers, and subject matter experts applying elements of mathematics, statistics, computer science, and application-specific knowledge to gather, make, and communicate principled conclusions from data developing enterprise-grade analytic capabilities.
Program Mission:
U.S. Special Operations Command requires professional services to carry out culturally relevant internet-based influence activities for synchronizing, planning, generating, and assessing the effectiveness of the global program. These activities provide the Department of Defense with the ability to conduct persistent, networked, and distributed operations in the information environment to counter terrorist ideology, malign influence from state actors, and provide global stability.
This position is CONTINGENT upon contract award, the expected award date is in September 2023. Our recruiting team will follow up with you on your application and will be starting the interview evaluation process immediately.
Here’s What You’ll Need:

2+ years of experience with data science, data analytics, machine learning, or statistics, including in a management or advisory role
Experience with object-oriented programming language SQL and one of the following; Python, C++, Java, R.
Experience with cloud services, including AWS and Azure.
Experience with identifying and analyzing data sets to meet customer requirements
Experience with preparing customer data for models, including merging and aggregating data, handling anomalies, balancing, and feature selection
Experience in data validation and cleaning to ensure the quality and integrity of data
Experience with AI/ML, data algorithms, and predictive models
Ability to help interpret model results and communicate them clearly through compelling data visualizations
TS/SCI eligibility (Employer may sponsor)
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
Desired Qualifications:
Experience with a wide range of supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques, including neural networks, decision trees, logistic regressions, or dimension reduction
Experience with data engineering and data science tools, including Databricks, ElasticSearch, Apache NiFi, or StreamSets
Experience with enterprise DataOps, DevSecOps, and MLOps processes to operationalize and monitor data science models
Experience with Agile development
Experience with CI/CD, including Git, Jenkins, and Docker
Experience with data analysis and reporting, including dashboard development, data cleansing, metrics analysis, and research
Knowledge of procedural SQL language, including PL and PGSQL
Ability to explain analytic and model findings to non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, CS, Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, or Statistics
