The Data Analyst position we have open is a Crime Analyst assigned to the Police Department.

JOB SUMMARY:
Performs professional, technical, and analytical work involved in researching, compiling, analyzing, evaluating, and disseminating program related data and other related information. Performs systematic and analytical processes directed at providing pertinent information relative to trend correlations and patterns to assist operational and administrative personnel in planning the resources. Supports reporting and forecasting needs of the assigned Department.
CLASS CHARACTERISTICS:
This classification performs entry-level to journey-level statistical analysis and analytical research involving the use of computer applications, random statistical samplings, correlation and regression analysis, and probability studies. This classification is distinguished from the Administrative Analyst through a focus on operational analysis, while the Administrative Analyst focuses on administrative analysis.
SUPERVISION
SUPERVISION RECEIVED AND EXERCISED:
This classification receives general direction from a department head or senior management staff member within a framework of established policies and procedures. Direction may be provided to support staff on a project or program basis.
EXAMPLES OF DUTIES
EXAMPLES OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
(Any one position may not include all of the duties listed nor do the listed examples include all tasks that may be found in positions of this class.)
Performs statistical analysis and analytical research involving the use of computer applications, random statistical samplings, correlation and regression analysis, and probability studies;
Assist with the development of agency tactics, strategies, and planning in response to trends.
Assist department personnel in monitoring and tracking program-related activity and developing methods and procedures for the dissemination of information to key stakeholders;
Develops, provides, and prevents analysis reports.
Gives oral presentations on statistics and trends. Produces written reports with clearly organized thoughts using proper sentence structure, punctuation, and grammar in order to disseminate information.
Analyzes raw data in order to make recommendations in a written report format regarding patterns and trends.
Draws or letters charts, schedules, graphs, and maps to illustrate patterns/trends and statistical findings utilizing computer-aided graphics.
Observes, compares, and monitors data including departmental reports and computer-generated statistics to determine compliance with analysis procedures.
Inspects and monitors computer software for proper operation. Writes computer programs for specific crime analysis projects.
Conduct procedural and operational studies in order to outline problems and recommend solutions.
Measures program outcomes to determine the meeting of intended goals and reports validity of program under evaluation.
Monitors and keeps up to date on new trends and approaches related to data analysis.
Maintains a variety of records and reports and keeps accurate records of all work orders and service requests.
Performs duties similar to the above in scope and function as required.

In addition to the above, incumbents assigned to the police department will be required to perform the following duties:
Views, evaluates, and forecasts future crime occurrences by comparing unique descriptors and/or variables as well as developing and comparing target/suspect profiles, suspect/crime correlations, and offender characteristics.
Enters, searches, and retrieves information utilizing a terminal or personal computer (PC) in order to collate and analyze crime statistics, maintain histories of crime information, and compiles crime bulletins.
Communicates with the general public, other City employees, and outside law enforcement personnel in order to collect crime information for conducting crime analyses.
Produces crime analysis bulletins with clearly organized thoughts using proper sentence structure, punctuation, and grammar in order to disseminate crime statistics, suspect information, and Modus Operandi (M.O.) patterns.
Sorts, separates, arranges, and files police reports, crime statistics, bulletins, and articles in a prescribed manner in order to maintain a history of crime-related statistics and perform crime analyses.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:
Knowledge of:
Research design methods, procedures, and techniques used in statistical analysis;
Principles of mathematics and statistics.
Methods and techniques of data collection, research, and report preparation.
Statistical program languages; and data processing methods, procedures, and equipment.
Applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations.
Computer software packages designed for statistical data.
Modern office practices, methods, and computer equipment.
Principles and practices of record keeping.

Ability to:
Communicate effectively with City staff, the general public, and others contacted in the course of work.
Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and data.
Effectively prioritize work; work under pressure within time constraints.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the course of work.
Learn and apply the uniform crime reporting processes and requirements.
Prepare accurate, effective, and timely reports, correspondence, and other written materials.
Learn and apply the principles and practices of police and public administration.
Acquire knowledge of law enforcement needs, techniques, methods, and legal demands.
Learn computer software applications in use or being developed by the City for crime analysis.
Collect, extrapolate, analyze, interpret, and document complex statistical data.
Properly develop and interpret tables, charts, and graphs.
Prepare graphic representations of detailed and complex statistical findings or results.
Vision to read printed materials and a computer screen.
Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.
TYPICAL QUALIFICATIONS
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Graduation from an accredited college or university with a bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Statistics, or area related to assigned department.

and

Two years of statistical analysis and presentation, including graphics and statistical correlation, preferably in a public sector agency.

or

An equivalent combination of education and experience.

POSSESSION AND MAINTENANCE OF:
A valid California class C driver's license and a satisfactory driving record.
Certification in Crime and Intelligence Analysis (CCIA) preferred for Data Analyst assigned to the police Department.

IN ADDITION, POSITION ASSIGNED TO THE POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL BE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING BEFORE A FINAL OFFER IS MADE:
Polygraph
Police Background Investigation
Credit Check
Live Scan Fingerprinting – DOJ

Top Skills
Experience handling large datasets
In-depth/expert skills with SQL and database query tools
In-depth ability to analyze, interpret, and present data
Tableau (other BI tools ok, but not the preference)
Requirements definition and refinement
Experience producing insights on poorly defined topics
Comfortable balancing independent ownership and working with support teams

Nice to have
AWS experience (S3/ EMR/Lambda)
Hive/Hadoop or experience working with big data platforms
Spark
Data Science
Python or Bash scripting
Linux
git
Project Management
Manage priorities and delivery across many workstreams
Bachelor's degree+ in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Engineering, Mathematics or related field

By joining Chubb as a Senior Data Analyst, you will analyze and certify data, troubleshoot data issues, promote data quality, work directly with the business and developers to document requirements and technical specifications and lead the delivery of key projects in support of North America financial reporting from the enterprise data warehouse and associated data marts, including the Business Analytics Repository (BAR). BAR is a strategic application within the business, feeding into multiple systems and applications both up and downstream with data that directly supports business decisions being made each and every day. With us, you’ll leverage your knowledge of SQL and database tables to analyze data, identify gaps or discrepancies, and partner with applications teams, IT teams across the business, our stakeholders, and our Data Architect to drive solutions that directly impacts how data is used throughout the business. You will lead financial reporting initiatives, delivering solutions from inception to deployment while working within budget and timelines. Through it all, we’ll also look to you to share your ideas and manage data related projects end to end that influence how we incorporate, validate, and distribute data enterprise-wide.
In this role, you will:
Lead all phases of the development, testing, and implementation life cycle, defining, documenting and reviewing all requirements, creating test scenarios, developing test plans, analyzing results and testing/validating data
Work with business partners, project management, architecture, development and leadership to deliver reporting solutions on-time, within budget and with data accuracy.
Document requirements, technical specifications and implementation documentation on all developed solutions.
Reconcile multiple data sources and identify the root cause of discrepancies in expected output; distinguish between multiple root causes and/or multiple trends in a given data set and articulate results to various stakeholders, management, and technical resources
Analyze and test relational databases and investigate any data load failures or data retrieval issues
Monitor data warehousing systems based on assigned tasks to ensure reliability and accuracy of information loaded into the databases
Generate reports, dashboards, and ad hoc extracts for business and/or leadership
Ensure data integrity by implementing quality assurance practices, gathering, and entering missing data, and resolving any anomalies

The Healthcare Data Analyst will play a crucial role in our multi-disciplinary team, utilizing data analytics to identify potential fraud, waste, or abuse of Medicaid or other healthcare system funds. This position requires proficiency in SQL, as the analyst will be responsible for reviewing and analyzing provider claims to determine if overpayments or underpayments have occurred in accordance with applicable policies. Additionally, the analyst will perform reimbursement calculations to quantify mispayments and prepare necessary documentation and reports.
Essential Functions:
Independently conduct complex analyses and audits related to Medicaid or other reimbursement-related engagements, with a focus on identifying fraud, waste, abuse, or misuse of funds.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of Medicaid and/or other payer statutes, regulations, provider billing manuals, and healthcare reimbursement policies.
Conduct research to determine the standards for billing and coding compliance with Medicaid or other government program regulations.
Draft and issue notification letters to healthcare providers regarding identified overpayments or underpayments, ensuring clear and concise communication.
Interpret and analyze healthcare data, including medical, financial, or other records, to identify inconsistencies, anomalies, abnormal billing patterns, and indicators of suspected fraud, waste, or abuse (e.g., services not rendered, up-coding, un-bundling, etc.).
Prepare comprehensive reports summarizing findings and recommendations for corrective actions.
Present findings to clients, effectively communicating complex data analysis in a clear and concise manner.
Collaborate effectively with team members, providing mentorship, training, and assistance as needed.
Maintain the security and confidentiality of all protected health information encountered during the performance of duties.
Participate in client meetings and conference calls as required.
Handle phone calls and emails from providers, addressing any questions or concerns.
Evaluate business processes to identify opportunities for improvement.
Perform additional responsibilities as assigned.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Health Information Administration, Health Informatics, Healthcare Management, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. A postgraduate degree in a related field is preferred.
Preferred certifications: CFE, AHFI, CHDA, CPMA, RHIT, or RHIA.
1-2 years of experience in healthcare data analysis or a related field is preferred.
SQL proficiency is required, preferably with experience in working with large healthcare datasets.
Familiarity with statistical analysis techniques and data mining methodologies is preferred.
Proficient use of Microsoft Office software (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.).
Organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to think independently and problem solve effectively.
Demonstrated ability to communicate verbally and in writing with all levels of an organization, both internally and externally.
Effective in multitasking, prioritization of assignments, and management of multiple deadlines.
Ability to work in a team environment.
Willingness to travel based on client and business needs (0-10% of the time).
Must be able to travel based on client and business needs
The Team:
Myers and Stauffer takes pride in the welcoming and collaborative culture we have throughout our offices. For this position, the employee will report to one of our Managers or Senior Managers on the BPI engagement team.
Work Style:
Our general business hours are Monday through Friday 8am-5pm, but can vary based on business needs. Dependent on performance, our in-office associates are eligible for a hybrid work schedule after their initial 90-day training period. As a company, we are always willing to discuss potential flexibility that an employee may need to better suit their work-life wellbeing.

In person or remote interview with the hiring manager & team
Hiring decision and job offer

Performs root cause analysis.
Drive data quality by validating data & metrics calculations, surfacing quality issues, documenting, and remediating data quality issues.

Description
University Health Network (UHN) is hiring a Data Analyst of Clinical Integration to work in the growing field of Healthcare Value Based Care. Join us for the opportunity to grow your database/analysis skills and learn about the exciting field of Population Health.

About University Health Network
University Health Network is a clinically integrated network and manages University Health ACO, LLC (an accountable care organization). We work in partnership with the University of Tennessee Medical Center, University Physicians’ Association (UPA), area physicians, and commercial and Medicare insurance companies. We strive to deliver the healthcare triple aim: Better care for individuals, better health for populations, and lowering growth in expenditures.

What you will do:
The Data Analyst is a full-time position that is responsible for analyzing large sets of data from multiple sources. The Data Analyst creates and validates multiple end user reports weekly and monthly. They will also monitor process performance, satisfaction of our customers, and identify improvements in data collection that will better meet the needs of the department. Experience with SQL is ideal as well as familiarity with data visualization and data automation. Performs other duties as assigned.

Position requires normal business hours Monday-Friday. This position offers work at home option for employees who meet performance requirements, with occasional on-site meetings. Candidate must be able to maintain HIPAA privacy requirements when working from home. Candidate must be located in the East Tennessee region.

Full benefit package available, including PTO, Sick Leave, Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, Life Insurance, 401k with company match and immediate vesting, Critical Illness, and more!
Requirements
BS in Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or relevant field desired.
Proven working experience as a data analyst or similar role required.
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, R, or SQL.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Experience in one of the following programming languages (e.g., HTML, CSS, C++, Java, Python, JavaScript) is a plus.
Position requires normal business hours Monday-Friday.
Candidate must be located in the East Tennessee region.

Overview:
We are seeking a full-time Aeronautical Data Analyst 1 in our St. Louis location. In this role, you will be responsible for the attribution, processing, evaluation, and maintenance of aeronautical data and the execution of Quality Assurance processes.
Responsibilities:
Essential Functions
Edit, manipulate and maintain aeronautical data using custom and 3rd party software
Ensure the application of appropriate aeronautical specifications to the data and products
Help evaluate and process database updates according to established methodology
Identify and resolve basic issues or risks using proper aeronautical data capture techniques
Conduct testing and evaluation of GARMIN aeronautical data products
Demonstrate fundamental understanding of Garmin’s Aeronautical Data development process
Document work thoroughly in an organized manner
Demonstrate ability to learn, understand, provide input and apply established or new processes and projects
Demonstrate the ability to recognize and process multiple source types; translate/culminate necessary information for tasks within standard framework
Incorporate field knowledge within documented standards framework to identify and creatively solve problems
Work periodic over-time, holidays, and weekends as necessary
Data Collection Team:
Input or update, perform a QC process on, and maintain the features in the National Airspace System Resources (NASR) database
Maintain a working knowledge of the functionality of the National Airspace System (NAS), to include the direct correlation in support of Instrument Flight Rules (IFR) and on-board Flight Management Systems (FMS)
Maintain a working knowledge of the development, review and analysis of airspace structure to include new design processes and procedures
Production Team:
Acquire and maintain DO-200A associate qualifications according to applicable sections of the Personnel Qualification Manual
Acquire and maintain DO-200A initial and follow-on training requirements according to applicable sections of the Training Plan
Insert, update, and delete records in AeroNavData’s DO-200A qualified database
Process aeronautical source from the Standard and Non-Standard Aeronautical Information Publications (AIPs) listed in the Data Source Manual
Acquire a basic understanding of the ARINC 424 specifications
Interface with NFDC and AeroNav Products associates via e-mail or phone when directed
Interface with the Civil Aviation Authorities (CAA) via e-mail or phone when directed
Use and understand database queries written for our Microsoft SQL Server database using the Structured Query Language (SQL)
Qualifications:
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Aviation OR instrument rated pilot, Navigator, Air Traffic Controller, Aeronautical Analyst, or Military TERPS Specialist OR 2 years relevant experience OR substantial demonstrated aeronautical knowledge
Excellent academics (cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.0 as a general rule)
Demonstrate a basic working knowledge and understanding of aeronautical charting principles relevant to GARMIN’s business needs
Desired Qualifications
Outstanding academics (cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.5)
Previous work experience as an air traffic controller, military TERPS Specialist or aeronautical information specialist
Private Pilot’s License with instrument rating strongly preferred
Demonstrate an understanding of instrument flight rules, instrument procedures, and the United States National Airspace System
Familiarity with Cartography, GIS principles and methodologies
Bilingual skills

Garmin International is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran’s status, age or disability.

AT A GLANCE
As a Data Analyst for RVO Health, you drive problem-solving with autonomy, while being an expert at querying, transforming, and providing analytical insights. Our Data Analysts dig deep into the business and provide data solutions with advanced analytics, business intelligence and data science to drive success and enrich the user experience. As a Data Analyst, you will communicate, support, and strategize with business, tech, and data teams stakeholders. You will act as a data-savvy consultant, telling the data story by understanding processes, solving problems, and making business and marketing recommendations.
Where You'll Be
To prioritize togetherness, culture, and accountability, RVO Health operates on a hybrid in-office work schedule. We expect employees to work from our South Charlotte office Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday each week. You are welcome to work remotely Mondays and Fridays if you wish.
1101 Red Ventures Dr Fort Mill, SC 29707
What You'll Do
Provide strategic insights derived from digital marketing, web event, sales, and coaching data that drive marketing investment and customer experience decisions
Use statistics to identify the significance, noise, and correlation in data
Conduct hands-on advanced analytics using multiple data sources originating from different applications and systems
Build relationships with business teams and data science teams to identify opportunities for deep analytics on customer behavior and site performance
Build compelling visualizations and interactive dashboards that enable us to democratize analvtics
Work with data science, data engineers, and business teams to build scalable and effective data products
Identify opportunities to use advanced analytics to develop new strategies and improve business performance
What We're Looking For
Minimum of 2+ years of experience in complex business analysis, digital analysis, or marketing analysis role
Proficiency in visualization tools such as Looker or Tableau
Extensive experience in building SQL queries across complex relational database experience
Experience designing scalable data models and ETLs
Demonstrated ability to solve problems with creativity and little direction
Demonstrated ability to synthesize data into impactful insights and communicate recommendations to leadership
Effective interpersonal and communication skills, with a track record of working well with business stakeholders

Access to a Free Udemy for Business subscription—thousands of hours of learning content on hundreds of different subjects at your fingertips
Health Insurance Coverage (medical, dental, and vision)
Life Insurance

Flexible Spending Accounts
Paid Time Off
Holiday Pay
401(k) with match
Employee Assistance Program
Paid Parental Bonding Benefit Program
This position may occasionally require travel for training and other work-related duties.
Who We Are:
Founded in 2022, RVO Health is a new healthcare platform of digital media brands, services and technologies focused on building relationships with people throughout their health & wellness journey. We meet people where they are in their personal health journeys and connect them with both the information and the care they need. RVO Health was created by joining teams from both Red Ventures and UnitedHealth Group's Optum Health. Together we're focused on delivering on our vision of a stronger and healthier world.
RVO Health is comprised of Healthline Media (Healthline, Medical News Today, Psych Central, Greatist and Bezzy), Healthgrades, FindCare and PlateJoy; Optum Perks, Optum Store and the virtual coaching platforms Real Appeal, Wellness Coaching, and QuitForLife.
We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage, employee assistance program, 401(k) plan and a paid parental leave program.

Job Description:
The Role
The Data Analyst works closely with business and technical teams to drive the creation of scalable, flexible, well governed, and detailed data design solutions. They drive adoption of enterprise and industry standard modeling methodologies. They partner with project teams to deliver practical & resilient data model designs that meet current business needs and are capable of easily adapting to new needs in the future.
The Expertise and Skills You Bring
Primary Responsibilities
Requirements and Analysis
Engage with business and technology partners to understand the business requirements, analyze the data gaps, and recommend appropriate solutions.
Assess objectives, use cases, data requirements and specifications documents created by other analysts.
Analyze and resolve major data issues that arise during the course of projects or in production environments.
Data Design
Define conceptual and logical data models, with strong definitions, to capture organizational data needs across multiple subject areas.
Build physical design for various types of systems such as operational systems, data warehouses, data lakes and others.
Actively perform dedicated and targeted data analysis to identify risks for management. Strong coordination with key business partners will be required to obtain data sets and confirm results of the analysis.
Document database solutions and present solutions to product partners, project teams, Data Engineering team and architecture review boards.
Passionate about technology and delivering solutions in integrated data environments. Current on event driven processing, and Data API developments.
Lead and facilitate work sessions with business functions and projects to define requirements, business term definitions and logical data models
Map Technical terms to Business terms in data catalog tool.
Technical Leadership
Provide mentorship and expertise to development community in effective implementation of data models and building of common data access services.
Provide strategy, data modeling with accountability on work initiative engagements and timeline. Align and ensure consistency to enterprise standards on technology, tools, and procedures.
Knowledge of and experience with tools, techniques and processes for complex data gathering, analysis and reporting on data for large organizations.
Find opportunities to use enterprise data models for new projects to minimize work and data duplication
Strong interest in playing a technical data steward role and partnering across our business to understand and document our data, appropriate data usages and helping Asset Mgmt. derive the maximum value from its data.
Qualifications
Education and Experience (dependent on level)
A Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent experience
10+ years’ experience with data design, analysis, and development. Development experience weighted towards PL/SQL and ETL tools.
Demonstrated experience in the following areas : Database Management Systems, Data API design and implementation, PL/SQL, warehouses, data modeling and data profiling.
Skills and Knowledge
Demonstrable experience with SAP Power Designer or similar data modeling tool required.
Advanced analytical and problem solving skills.
Advanced understanding of the database development process including analysis, design, coding, testing, problem resolution and planning, and full competency in all relevant coding environments, languages, tools, and platforms
Outstanding interpersonal skills and strong verbal and written skills to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical associates in the company
Proven interpersonal skills, including the ability to work across the organization and interact/influence/negotiate optimally at all levels of management and peers.
Growing our agile development culture through use of excellent engineering skills and a deep knowledge of industry standard methodologies
Experience in working in data management / governance with an understanding on how data is ingested, stored, and maintained.
Understanding of principles and standard methodologies around Data Architecture
Ability to prioritize data analysis initiatives based on business criticality.
Experience in the financial services industry area a plus
The Team
Asset Management Technology is seeking a Principal level candidate in the data analysis and data modeling organization. The successful candidate will be responsible for leading data modeling and analysis across different projects with diverse scope and complex business and technical requirements in a highly integrated data environment. This role requires working autonomously and under consultative direction for achieving organizational strategic data goals. This is a key role in leading the development of high-quality data model, working as part of a team that helps to deliver data as a key asset for the enterprise. You must be comfortable working in a fast paced and highly ambiguous agile environment where there is a focus on timely delivery of data analysis, data models and other data artifacts.

Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. Overview:
Job specifications are intended to present a descriptive list of the range of duties performed by
employees. Specifications are not intended to reflect all duties performed within the job.

SUMMARY:

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to support the National Security Innovation Network (NSIN)’s Defense Innovation OnRamp Hubs (Hubs). NSIN is an organization dedicated to fostering innovation and collaboration within the national security community, and the 5 hubs around the country will play a crucial role in developing and scaling-up the Regional Network Team and maximizing the impact on the mission. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in assisting with the planning, coordination, and execution of various programs and projects. Your analytical skills, attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment will contribute to the success of NSIN's mission.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for the success of internal data-centric business operations and the decisions made to meet Government goals, all to drive greater efficiency and accuracy of executing the mission. This will require the Data Analyst to build insightful reports, research ventures and innovators across the US, and present their products to Government Leadership - all while embodying high standards of Tatitlek’s professionalism.
The Data Analyst will work closely with the Hubs PM and NSIN’s Data Cell Lead to fulfil the critical innovation mission of our DOD customer. The key responsibilities of the position will be:
Utilize NSIN’s and the Hubs’ data and information about innovation in the US for use in analyzing trends and patterns around the defense ecosystem, technology transition, small businesses, and investments.
Help build and maintain the data network, policies and processes connecting the NSIN Regional Network Team, Portfolios and the Hubs.
Generate monthly reports on how well NSIN components and the overall enterprise are working based on agency KPIs and OKRs.
Support enterprise data migrations for large scale IT projects. Ensure integrity and related attribute data are backed up.
Provide 1:1 assistance to the rest of the workforce and delivery partners regarding how to record their activities and how to utilize the data for their own products.
Track and respond to ad hoc product requests from leaders across the agency in a timely and polite manner.
Use data profiling and other discovery techniques to locate anomalies, outliers, and other instances that would cause a bottleneck in business operations.
Design and execute models for improved data collection, continually pivoting as needed to support the business.
Interpret key datasets to recommend process improvement opportunities.
Support the team in maintaining and supporting several activities, including entering and cleaning data, researching data conversions, establishing data specifications, updating sources, and ensuring data integrity.
Mine data for the purposes of experimenting predictive model prototypes.

NON-ESSENTIAL DUTIES:

Other job-related duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree in Math, Operations Research, Statistics, Data Analytics, or similar analytic-heavy programs - OR equivalent experience in Data Analytics.
At least 5-7 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Business Analytics, Statistics, Data Analysis, or other related jobs.
Experience writing advanced MS Excel and Google Sheet formulas, creating pivot tables, and other queries.
Aptitude to quickly learn and apply unfamiliar models and analysis techniques. To continually improve available technical skillsets.
Theoretical knowledge and ample experience designing, building, and managing databases both structured and unstructured. Cross-walking field values and attributes from the origin to the destination while reconciling errors.
Demonstrated ability to query information and visually present trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Ability to work as a team and independently.
Ability to troubleshoot and offer possible solutions to common problems arising from any data holding.
Excellent technical writing skills, including the ability to communicate analytic results to other business departments at all organization levels.
Additional Desired Qualifications:
Ability to work in SQL, Python, R, and/or Javascript languages.
Salesforce-related skills and knowledge. Specifically of SOSL, SOQL, Einstein Analytics, and the platform’s Data Wizard.
Experience working in SmartSheet. Especially, building reports and data visualizations.
Experience with AWS S3 Buckets and other AWS means of storage.
Knowledge of building visualizations in any of the following: Tableau, Kibana, R Shiny, R Studio, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly, D3.js, or other equivalent tools.
Knowledge of mapping networks and geospatial locations.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable
accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Essential functions may require maintaining physical condition necessary for frequently bending, stooping, sitting, walking or standing for prolonged periods of time; most of time is spent sitting in a comfortable position with the opportunity to move about. Occasionally there may be a need to move or lift moderately light items up to 35 pounds. Near visual acuity to review written documentation; ability to hear and understand speech at normal room levels and on the telephone; manual dexterity to operate a telephone and keyboard; lift horizontally and vertically.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Job is performed in an office setting with exposure to computer screens and requires extensive use of a computer, keyboard, mouse and multi-line telephone system. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

None

ADDITIONAL QUALIFYING FACTORS:

As a condition of employment, must pass a pre-employment drug screening, as well as have acceptable reference and background check results.

We support and obey laws that prohibit discrimination everywhere we do business.

Overview:
Boston Government Services has a need for a Data Analyst for the State and Community Energy Program.
BGS is an engineering, technology, and security firm helping to advance missions of national importance for government programs, national laboratories, national security facilities, nuclear operations, and complex projects. We support clients at every stage, from strategic planning and program management to the execution of engineering and technical activities. We work to attract and retain the best talent because the best talent delivers the best results for our clients. Our capabilities are based on our experience in complex, secure, and highly regulated environments. We leverage our experience and capabilities to provide mission-driven solutions tuned to our client’s mission needs and strategic direction.
Supports the Department of Energy’s (DOE) State and Community Energy Program (SCEP) to provide data analysis and reporting support using data from multiple sources including the Performance and Accountability for Grants in Energy (PAGE) system, which is a tool that provides DOE and grantees, including state and local governments, and tribal organizations the ability to electronically submit and manage grant performance and financial information. Support includes, but is not limited to, data collection, management, analysis, reporting, and presentation. The position will have day to day interactions with internal State Energy Program (SEP) support teams, as well as external communication with stakeholders in state and local agencies, academia, private industry, and DOE National Laboratories, as needed.

Position Requirements Include:
Develop statistical packages to track execution and performance of energy grants.
Collect and analyze data to assess the status and impacts of energy grants.
Develop data reports and analysis on various program metrics.
Qualifications:
Requires a strong data management and analysist background and ability to manage multiple projects and tasks to meet congressionally mandated deadlines. Advanced data analysis and report development skills using PAGE, Excel, SPSS, SAS, MatLab, R, Python, and/or VBA is a plus.

Required Skills:
Bachelor’s Degree or higher from an accredited university.
At least 5 years of data analysis and data management experience.
Strong attention to detail.
Perform calmly and effectively on quick turnaround data and analysis requests.
Work in a collaborative environment.
Highly proficient in Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint.
Must be US citizen.
Successful drug screening.
Must be eligible to obtain and maintain a security clearance.

Education & Experience

Title: Master Data Analyst @ Ann Arbor, MI.
Terms of Hire: Full Time.
Job Summary::
Position Overview::
Opportunity to lead efforts to develop, create and streamline the global master data processes across Client. The Master Data Analyst is responsible for defining, processing, documenting, and monitoring master data requirements for key domains such as, Finished Goods, Raw Materials, BOMs, Rate Routing, MRO and products with the purpose of improving data quality. This position will be an integral part of the procurement MDM & P2P team and the scope will include custodianship of all master data worldwide including material master records in SAP MDG and bills of materials, rate routings, Purchasing Info Records in SAP ECC.
Essential Responsibilities and Duties::
Manage business requirements gathering, future state data maintenance process and data structure design, system functional configuration, testing and on-going support of SAP MDG for Finished Goods, Raw Materials BOMs, Rate Routing, MRO, Vendors
Lead the cleansing, transformation, conversion, and remediation of data efforts across key business domains such as direct materials (Finished Goods, Raw Materials, BOMs)
Design and manage data standards (business glossary and technical metadata) for key master data domains in SAP MDG and monitor their compliance leveraging SAP Information Steward
Utilize standard set of tools to effectively manage the master data change process. Standardize data conventions, processes
Leverage processes and tools to execute data migration, ensure the development of master data creation and management procedures to effectively manage master data
Support with data entry for direct materials such as Finished Goods, Raw Materials, BOMs, Rate Routing, and discontinuation through the defined processes
Manage the efforts to identify, troubleshoot, cleanse, organize and update data on an on-going basis
Lead audit of master data in SAP systems for compliance with data standards, governance policies and procedures
Travel 25%
Relationships::
Reports directly to the Procurement Manager – Analytics/Data Management
Partner with the following internal customers/other colleagues:
Procurement Leadership Team, Leaders from Commercial, Finance, Supply Chain and Operations.
Works closely with NA IT
Master Data Analyst, Sr procurement Systems Analyst, Procurement Analysts, Regional Buyers and Regional Buyer Lead
Partner the following external stakeholders:
Procurement systems vendor customer support teams/consultants
Skills Required::
Excellent command of spoken and written English
Demonstrated proficiency in one or more functional domains with SAP MDG is required, including hands-on configuration aptitude
Ability to lead requirements gathering, future state design and fit-gap analysis workshops with business stakeholders is a must
Ability to plan, measure and report progress on projects or business initiatives
Excellent interpersonal, leadership, verbal and written communication skills required
Knowledge and Experience::
Bachelor’s degree required, with concentration in Industrial, Computer Science or Mechanical Engineering, Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Information System
A minimum of 3 years’ work experience with SAP Master Data Management (MM) and Production Planning (PP) modules
At least 3 years’ experience with SAP EIM tools such as MDG, NetWeaver MDM, in the capacity of a functional/business analyst

Description:
Spatial Front provides IT solutions to federal, state, and local governments, and the private sector.
Project Overview:
The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) Electronic Submission Gateway (ESG) is an Agency Wide solution for accepting electronic regulatory submissions. The FDA ESG enables the secure submission of regulatory information for review and enables the FDA to process regulatory information automatically, functioning as a single point of entry for receiving and processing all electronic submissions in a highly secure environment that complies with secure Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) messaging standards and uses digital certificates, including electronic acknowledgement of submissions. The FDA ESG is the central receipt point for sending information electronically to the FDA. Within that context, the FDA ESG is a conduit, or “highway”, in which submissions travel to the proper FDA Center or Office for further review. As part of the FDA mission, the DAS EAB team manages and supports a number of enterprise and shared applications such as the FDA Unified Registration and Listing System (FURLS), the FDA Electronic Submission Gateway (ESG) and ALP that are essential to the FDA in completing its mission to serve America’s health and safety.
Primary Responsibilities:
Candidates must be willing to work regular business hours synced with Eastern Standard Time.
Assist senior members of staff, as well as government clients.
Provide support for deliverables such as reports (weekly, monthly, etc.), data calls, tracking logs, stage gates and baseline reviews, program/project schedules and strategy plans.
Support meetings & take meeting minutes, send for distribution.
Provide support to FDA ALP and/or FURLS.
Demonstrate a capacity for quality control and quality management.
Provide superior customer service.
Apply, as appropriate, activity and data modeling, transaction flow analysis, internal control and risk analysis, and modern business methods and performance measurement techniques.
Assist in establishing standards for information systems procedures.
Develop and apply organization-wide information models for use in designing and building integrated, shared software and database management systems.
Construct sound, logical business improvement opportunities consistent with corporate information management guiding principles, cost savings, and open system architecture objectives.
Requirements:
Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in related field.
Minimum 3-5 years of experience is required.
Ability to pass a US Public Trust background investigation for access to the client site and computing systems.
Additional Information:
In order to meet the clearance requirements for this opportunity, candidates must be authorized to work in the US.
All candidates will be subject to a complete background check to include, but not limited to Criminal History, Education Verification, Professional Certification Verification, Verification of Previous Employment and Credit History.
Public Trust background investigations can take approximately four to eight weeks and requires fingerprinting.
Other Information:
The salary for this position is $60,000 - $90,000 annually
For information on SFI's benefits please visit http://www.spatialfront.com/pages/career.html
This is a full-time W2 position.
Please no agencies, third parties, or corp-to-corp.
Spatial Front Inc. is an Equal-opportunity Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Job Description:
The Cloud Data Engineer will contribute to Omni’s Modern data platform on the Azure Cloud by maintaining and enhancing the data lake and the lake house with new data sources from different types of sources and supporting the analytics team to create data marts and self-service datasets for reporting and dashboards.
Responsibilities:

Collaborate with business leaders, subject matter experts, and decision-makers to develop scope of work, success criteria and create new data streams and optimize existing pipelines.
Ability to work with different source systems storage model both in cloud and on-premises to evaluate underlying schemas, datasets and produce pipeline rule engine.
Good understanding of data de-duping, data wrangling and data profiling using Python.
Scoping and/or evaluating the scope of work for each subject area requirements.
Build data quality checks, automated testing, and monitoring into solution delivery
Use structured decision-making and following project timelines to complete projects

Intermediate level of programming skills in Python and SQL, stored procedures. With 4 to 5 year Experience in Python, SQL, Docker and/or extensive use in the delivered projects.
Previous proven work with Apache workflow or DBT or Azure ADF.
Experience with REST APIs for data integration, web protocol as data delivery platform.
Knowledge of both Windows and Linux VM consoles with PowerShell and Linux Bash scripts.

Bonus point if you have worked with Machine Learning Python Libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Tensor flow, OpenCV.

U.S. Bank has a rare Data Analytics opportunity to support client service centers. We are seeking an individual with strong experience gathering, compiling and analyzing large volumes of data and interpreting trends to provide recommendations for action. On top of strong analytical skills this individual will need to have a collaborative mindset as the Data Analytics role will partner with Operations leadership, data analytics, strategy/governance team and other various partners. Our ideal candidate will have solid experience of customer contact centers and experience in SQL, Python along with data visualization tools such as Tableau, or Power BI. This individual will need to present data and analysis in a clear and concise manner allowing the audience to quickly understand the results and recommendations to activate upon to make data driven decisions. The Data Analyst will be responsible for working on migrations and large data analytics projects requiring the ability to join large data sets together and interpret results for use across the company. Ensures all data acquisition, sharing and results of applied recommendations are compliant with company standards.

Four to five years of statistical and/or data analytics experience

Experience in Python and SQL are strongly preferred as well as visualization experience (Tableau or Power BI)
Experience in analytics, advanced analytics/statistics, predictive modeling
Strong analytic skills with the ability to extract, collect, organize, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Advanced MS Office skills including Power Query in Excel
Demonstrated project management skills
Effective interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills

Job Description
BAE Systems, Inc is seeking an experienced Data Analyst for the Defense Threat Reduction Agency (DTRA) Advisory and Assistance Services (A&AS) Contract. DTRA is a Defense Agency providing operational and technical support to prevent nuclear proliferation and nuclear terrorism; maintain strategic stability at reduced nuclear force levels; and sustain a safe, secure, and effective nuclear arsenal. The DTRA A&AS Contract supports DTRA’s Nuclear Enterprise (NE) Directorate and provides administrative and technical support to enable the DTRA NE Directorate to research, plan, design, develop, implement, integrate, test, apply, and evaluate emerging and mature technologies to DTRA customers. This support requires close coordination and integration across the NE organization, and close ties across DTRA at all levels (Division to Directorate), and with external stakeholders and partners in order to effectively and efficiently execute requirements, as appropriate. This contract therefore requires dedicated and unbiased A&AS Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) who shall serve as DTRA’s "trusted agent," both internally and externally, in support of the NE Directorate.

The Data Analyst SME position specifically supports the Mission Assurance (NE-MA) Department within NE in their mission of conducting DoD vulnerability and survivability assessments for their customers, such as the Office of the Secretary of Defense, The Joint Staff, Combatant Commanders, Military Services, and other Department of Defense (DoD) components. NE-MA assesses mission survivability of U.S. and allied systems against a broad spectrum of threats, focusing on critical national mission systems. Their Red Team Program emulates foreign intelligence service and terrorist organization capabilities in order to assess mission vulnerabilities of selected national assets.

The Data Analyst SME will work a high-visibility mission-critical function and be responsible for:
Assisting the Department in conducting strategic analysis of internal and external assessment data for DoD critical missions to identify systemic vulnerabilities based on a broad array of threats to DoD installations, sites, critical infrastructure, and assets
Collecting, analyzing, correlating, and interpreting data using quantitative and qualitative methods; presenting data to the Department for the purpose of highlighting trends
Using integrated relational computer systems to create and access database files and preparing charts, graphs, and exhibits
Conducting comprehensive research projects, including assisting with programs evaluation studies and other administrative studies as assigned
Compiling, updating, and managing all-program data and producing the Department’s annual report
Conducting special projects and presenting unbiased data based solely on trend and statistical information
Effectively communicating to senior leadership through briefings, written/verbal correspondence, and other means as necessary, that can be understood at multiple levels
#DTRA05

Position summary

As a Data Analyst, you'll utilize modern BI tools and data platforms to analyze data, trends, and insights, and develop operational, business, and key service analytics for internal business partners. Your focus will be to transform complex data into information which can offer ways to improve our business, impacting business decisions.

This is a fulltime salaried hybrid that will require one to be onsite at least two days per week.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with the product owner and other internal stakeholders to understand and define the data and analytics requirements for business decision-making.
Analyze, interpret and translate complex data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations for the business owners & leaders.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that effectively visualize key performance indicators and business trends.
Use statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive business analytics.
Support the scrum master in backlog refinement and sprint planning activities by providing insight into data complexities and availability.
Collaborate with the data engineer in the formulation of processes for data extraction, transformation, and load (ETL).
Train end users on dashboard, reports, and the BI Platform.
Actionable Dashboards and Reports: Deliver reports and dashboards that visualize key performance indicators and business trends.
Data Analysis Reports: Provide comprehensive reports summarizing data analysis findings, including actionable insights and recommendations.
Data Insight for Sprint Planning: Provide data insight to support backlog refinement and sprint planning activities.
End User Training: Deliver effective training to end users on dashboards, reports, and the BI platform.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required in analytics, computer science or business administration.
5+ years of experience analyzing data, trends, and creating reports and analytics.
Experience using BI tools and global data platforms (PowerBI, Tableau, etc.).
Experience with best practices for data science, decision science, and business intelligence, including methodologies for ETL (SQL).
Knowledge of database principles and data formats and the ability to use it to organize, process, and analyze data.
Hands-on Experience with Queries, Data relationships, and basic programming.
Fluency in writing DAX Measures and Calculated Columns.
Fluency in Data Preparation, Data Modeling, and Data Visualization.
Microsoft Office experience, including intermediate excel skills.
Exposure to Cloud technology.
Desirable Criteria & Qualifications
Work experience with predictive analytic modeling tools such as R, Python, DataRobot, and Microsoft Azure ML.
Previous experience building Metrics, Balanced Score Cards, Key Performance Indicators, Data Analysis, with dashboard data visualization techniques.
Experience with analyzing data pulled from a data historian for a production environment.
Experience with the medical device industry is a plus.

Twin Cities PBS (TPT) is one of the most innovative public media organizations in the country. Every day, TPT uses the power of media to advance the arts, spur learning, help young people succeed and help adults age vitally. TPT presents extraordinary PBS programming and also produces award-winning content for the national PBS system.
Twin Cities PBS (TPT) is seeking a full-time Data Analyst to help drive data-informed decisions that advance our organizational mission and goals.
Salary: $75,000 - $85,000 Annually (depending on qualifications)
Hybrid Workplace: Candidates must live in or be willing to relocate to the Twin Cities Metro area.
MAJOR AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:
DATA MONITORING AND REPORTING (30%)
Maintain the key performance indicator (KPI) dashboard within TPT’s existing framework.
Review monthly data and provide regular performance updates through dashboards and presentations to staff and leaders.
Support data quality control by monitoring and providing recommendations to improve data quality from different data systems.
ORGANIZATIONAL ANALYTICS (40%)
Work with departments, including Content, Marketing, Evaluation, Advancement, and Finance to provide ad hoc analysis about broadcast and digital audience, member, and donor trends. Meet with departments to review analyses and support teams in using data to inform decisions.
Develop an understanding of audience and other data trends within public media. Utilize existing PBS-supported reporting to compliment and compare against TPT-specific reporting.
Develop framework for predictive analytics based on giving patterns and audience trends.
Support qualitative analyses as needed including coding open-ended survey data.
SYSTEM AND PROCESS IMPROVEMENT (25%)
Support the development of a centralized data function at TPT in partnership with TPT’s Chief Inclusion and Strategy Officer and Evaluation Director by providing key insights into data needs, analytic capabilities, and coordination needed across data systems.
Partner with the Information Technology department to provide input into the implementation of a data lakehouse and reporting system.
Be a critical stakeholder for process improvement, providing recommendations for new analytic tools and approaches to enhance TPT’s reporting and analytic capabilities.
OTHER DUTIES AS ASSIGNED (5% of time)
Participate as an active member of the IDEA Team. Contribute to shared goals and collaborate with colleagues on achievement of priorities.
Other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree.
2-4 years of experience in data analysis and reporting roles (data, marketing, financial analysis, or similar roles).
Intermediate level proficiency with the use of Power BI, Tableau, Amazon Quicksight, or other data visualization programs and Excel
1-2 years of experience with Salesforce or other CRM software.
1-2 years of experience with SQL.
PREFERRED SKILLS
4-7 years of experience in data analysis and reporting roles (data, marketing, financial analysis, or similar roles).
Intermediate level proficiency with the use of Power BI, Tableau, Amazon Quicksight, or other data visualization programs and Excel
2-4 years of reporting and analysis experience in media, audience development, or the non-profit sector.
1-2 years of experience leading or supporting the implementation of a database, data warehouse, or analytic system.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Ability to extract data from multiple sources and analyze using appropriate quantitative methods.
Ability to interpret data, discern trends, and communicate key insights or implications of data.
Excellent presentation and communication skills to share data in an easy-to-understand manner.
Ability to make data engaging through use of charts and visualization tools.
Demonstrated ability to influence and build credibility with a variety of leaders and stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.
Strong computer skills: Microsoft Office Suite – Outlook, Word, Excel, OneDrive, Teams, the Adobe Creative Suite.
Strong focus on audience and end user needs.
Strong organizational and time management skills. Able to multitask in a time sensitive production environment.
Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively with all team members.
Commitment to advancing Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Accessibility (IDEA) priorities within the organization.

Job Description:
NAVSEA is the Department of Navy's (DON's) central activity for designing, engineering, integrating, building, and procuring U.S. Naval ships, shipboard weapons, and combat systems.
NAVSEA's responsibilities also include the maintenance, repair, modernization, and conversion of in-service ships and their weapons and combat systems.
The candidate will provide data analytics support to the NAVSEA Comptroller (SEA 01). SEA 01 provides financial policy, advice and quality services to ensure NAVSEA's customers' budgets are efficiently and effectively executed. SEA 01 manages appropriation areas, provides cost engineering, and industrial analysis.
The candidate will support the full scope of Financial Data Analysis, to include the ongoing execution of data analysis systems, in partnership with SEA 01 staff, and the collection of financial and customer requirements to support the development of financial analysis tools.
Duties and responsibilities include:
Facilitate the collection of financial and customer requirements to develop financial tools.
Build data analysis tools and/or Microsoft Power Apps for data team use is support of the Comptroller.
Develop data analytic approaches, including return on investment measures, strategies, and performance indicators, dashboards, reports, and tools for Enterprise initiatives.
Provide maintenance for the integrity of all user/system data files, data verification following system restoration/recovery procedures, and data format conversion procedures during the import and/or export of data.
Develop operating procedures and user technical manuals for developed applications.
Support the completion and distribution of financial data analytics in support of Inspector General (IG) inspections, command goal Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and enterprise assessments.
Interface with required government and contractor personnel to collect, synthesize and analyze a wide array of data inputs, industry trend data and other relevant data sets to make recommendations and/or inform strategic decisions.
* Assist Financial Managers with obtaining, reviewing, and integrating financial data for input into the financial database. *Provide database reporting/printout support.
Requirements:
A minimum of 3 years of experience in data analytics/data science preferred.
A team-oriented outlook with outstanding customer service, collaboration and communication experience to support responses to funding requests, data calls and in the submittal of various reports.
• A basic understanding of the Navy budget process and the Budget Submitting Office (BSO).
Advanced experience using data and power applications.
Intermediate experience using Microsoft Excel.
Proficiency using SharePoint and Microsoft Teams.
Strong analytical skills along with discretion in performing specified work requirements.
Outstanding written (to include visual graphics) and oral communication skills to communicate effectively and to build and sustain working relationships with a vast team of diverse professionals.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office applications to include MS Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
Attention to detail and ability to meet tight deadlines, work independently and with sufficient knowledge, present projects to senior management.
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment accepting emergent tasking with little to no supervision and/or direction.
Bachelor’s Degree in related discipline preferred.
Must be able to obtain a secret security clearance
Must be a U.S. citizen

Position Description
Harris County Public Health has earned the 2023 Best Place for Working Parents Business Designation.

About Harris County Public Health:
Harris County Public Health (HCPH) includes a network of more than 700 public health professionals working together to improve health outcomes for the third most populous county in the United States. HCPH provides a multitude of services such as medical and dental services, community programming, and health education for the approximately 2.3 million people in unincorporated Harris County. Through its core values of innovation, engagement, and health equity, HCPH strives to bring meaningful solutions to public health issues while keeping Harris County healthy and vibrant.

Position Overview:
The Community Health and Violence Prevention Services Division (CHVPS) oversees the Holistic Assistance Response Team (TEAM), an alternative 911 program in Harris County as well as the RISE Program, which includes community and hospital violence interruption efforts.

Under the matrixed CHVPS division, the CHVPS Data Analyst works with cross functional teams within the division to create reports, build dashboards, and provide analyses that drive programs, division and organizational decision making. This position works with internal and external stakeholders using data to create deliverables that enable the CHVPS programs to use a public health approach to address the root causes of violence, protect, and promote health within the community.

The CHVPS data analyst will collect, analyze, and interpret and present statistical data and will also plan, develop, and report analyses of various efforts to help achieve health equity, health promotion, health protection, and operational excellence.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Responsible for the full life cycle of data analytics to include requirements gathering, analysis design, data collection and cleaning, performing analysis, and reporting findings.
Conducts research, analyzes data, and effectively communicates strategic data-driven recommendations.
Reports analytical findings and key takeaways using a clear and systematic approach.
Performs basic data management, data cleaning, data analysis, and data visualization using tools such as Excel, SQL, R, Python, and PowerBI.
Responsible for identifying, developing, and implementing recommendations to inform future data analytics projects.
Build and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders to ensure analyses are aligned with agency requirements; including working closely with the Office of Planning and Innovation on strategy and planning, and evaluation and performance management.
Performs ad-hoc data requests to enable data-driven decision making.
Develops well-crafted presentations as needed.
Other duties as assigned, including special tasks involved in responding to an emergency event.

Bachelor's Degree in Public Health, Computer Science, Data Science, Information Management, Statistics, or other related field.
Experience:
At least two (2) years of data analysis experience.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Moderate understanding of the principles of public health practice.
Hands on approach to planning and developing analyses that meet the needs of the business users.
Ability to conduct research, identify and understand data, and translate data into information for decision making and recommendations.
Demonstrable ability to communicate effectively in both oral, visual, and written formats, with ability to be efficient and consistently deliver high-quality work under time constraints.
Ability to visualize data and understanding of the principles of data storytelling.
Ability to organize and work independently on time-sensitive projects.
Ability to solve a variety of complex problems in the absence of technical guidelines and when creative thinking is required.

Job Description
Houlihan Lokey is looking for a Data Analyst to join their Corporate Finance Analytics team, specifically to support their Human Capital Group. This role involves using analytics and technology to improve current processes and create solutions. The Data Analyst will report to the Head of CF Analytics and will play a crucial role in introducing new platforms and enhancing existing capabilities for the company's growth.
This role requires strong analytical skills, a solid understanding of technology and data analytics, and the ability to work collaboratively across various teams. It also involves a focus on innovation and the ability to identify opportunities for technological advancements within the Human Capital Group. The Analyst's work will play a significant role in shaping the company's growth and efficiency strategies.
The responsibilities of the Data Analyst in this role will include:
Analyzing Processes: You will be responsible for assessing current processes within the Human Capital Group and identifying areas where technology and analytics can be applied to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
Solution Creation: You will develop solutions by leveraging data analytics, technology tools, and other relevant resources to address identified process gaps and challenges.
Implementation: After designing solutions, you will oversee the implementation process, ensuring that the new platforms and technology-driven processes are properly integrated into the existing systems.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Close collaboration with key stakeholders is crucial. You will work closely with various teams, departments, and leaders to understand their needs and demonstrate how technology can drive growth and efficiency.
Impact Assessment: Once the new solutions are implemented, you will be responsible for monitoring their adoption and measuring the impact on processes, efficiency, and overall outcomes.
Reporting: You will prepare reports and presentations to communicate the results of implemented solutions, contributing to the company's growth and streamlining operations.
Adaptation and Improvement: As the company evolves and new challenges arise, you will need to adapt strategies and solutions to ensure continued success and improvement.

Qualifications
1-3 years of experience using Python and/or SQL, accompanied by an understanding of data structures

The Data Analyst performs analysis and synthesis of data and information, uses accepted statistical methods to forecast future needs and costs and communicates in writing and orally.

The position reports to the Data Analysis and Reporting Team Manager and works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgement
Essential Responsibilities
This work is primarily related to the state of Texas criminal justice system.
Collect, organize, and assess data for accuracy.
Use statistical methods and software to analyze data sets and project program participation and costs.
Present and explain findings and recommendations to LBB management, legislative committees, and others.
Coordinate and collaborate with other LBB analysts on budget, performance, and revenue issues, as appropriate.
Inform LBB management of significant policy/budget issues and provide concise explanations and options for resolution.
Conduct quality assurance procedures to generate accurate and complete work products.
Prepare written reports that present and interpret data, identify alternatives, and make and justify recommendations.
Evaluate the implications of proposed or adopted federal and/or state legislation, rules, or regulations and make applicable recommendations.
Prepare fiscal and population impact estimates of recommendations and legislation.
Consult with LBB management to initiate studies, identify priorities, and define study scope, methodology, purpose, objectives, time frames, and resource requirements.
Research, evaluate, and refine projection methodologies.
Consult and communicate with external groups.
Contribute to agency projects and perform related work as assigned.
Essential Attributes and Skills
Think critically, take initiative, and use good judgment.
Communicate professionally in writing and orally (including presentations in formal and informal settings).
Create timely relevant, accurate, and polished work products.
Attentive to detail and complete tasks with an appropriate level of independence.
Use business tools successfully (i.e. Microsoft Office Suite, customized applications, desktop pc, laptop/tablet, and smart phone).
Use analytic software (i.e. SPSS, Simul8, etc.) and relational databases to analyze data sets.
Analyze, synthesize, and summarize quantitative and qualitative information.
Identify alternatives and make recommendations supported with empirical evidence.
Maintain confidential and sensitive information.
Follow agency protocols.
Understand legislative/budget processes and budget, performance, and operations of assigned agency/topic.
Willing and able to travel up to 10%.
Work at a computer and desk for extended periods of time.

Attributes Required of Every LBB Employee
Embrace agency mission/core values and follow policies, procedures, and processes.
Work effectively with LBB management and staff, as well as all external customers.
Coordinate, collaborate, and employ good interpersonal skills; demonstrate positive outlook.
Balance concurrent projects, work under pressure, and adapt to changing priorities/deadlines.
Act with motivation, organization, and attention to details; complete tasks with an appropriate level of independence.
Be punctual and have regular attendance.
Work overtime on nights, weekends, and holidays, as necessary to meet agency deadlines.
Education and Experience
Graduation with a baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university is required.
Course-work or degree in public policy or administration, program evaluation, quantitative research, qualitative research, educational measurement/research, financial affairs, math, statistics, legal research, or a related field is preferred.
Two years of progressively responsible full-time work experience in data collection, analysis, and error resolution is preferred.
Supplemental Information
To apply for this position, you may apply directly through the posting selected on our website, which will redirect you to NeoGov or go to https://www.governmentjobs.com/js_login.cfm An Account will be required to access this website.

Human Resources will not be able to retrieve your credentials or reset your password. Only on-line applications will be accepted via NeoGov.

Examples of an applicant's work product and/or copies of transcripts may be required as condition of interview. Finalist may be given a work-related exercise. The person hired may be required to submit official transcripts. Credentials earned at foreign colleges and/or universities must have been evaluated by an acceptable entity and must be equivalent to credentials awarded by U.S. regionally accredited institutions of higher education.

The person hired may not simultaneously be employed by the Legislative Budget Board (LBB) and another state agency or Texas public institution of public/higher education. Any job offer from the LBB is contingent upon proof of
eligibility/authorization to work in the United States on a full-time basis and proof of compliance with the Selective Service Law for males between the ages of 18 and 25.

LBB is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in employment or in the provision of services on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability. ABOUT THE ROLE
The Emerging Business team at Peloton is focused on driving efficient, outsized growth for Peloton through business model innovation, seeding and scaling early-stage businesses, and sales channel optimization. Emerging Business comprises several growth-oriented business units, including 1P Retail & Inside Sales, 3P Retail, Peloton for Business, Pre-Owned, Strategic Partnerships, Corp Dev, and International. The team is led by Dion Sanders, Peloton's Chief Emerging Business Officer.
We are looking for a strategic-minded data analyst to join our growing Emerging Business Team. Reporting to the Senior Director of Strategy & Business Operations, this person will gain a deep understanding of business context and needs, surface and enhance data on Emerging Business performance, and drive strategic decision-making through analysis and insights. They will partner cross-functionally with teams across Emerging Business, Finance, and Enterprise Data and will regularly communicate findings and implications to these stakeholders.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON
Partner with stakeholders to understand business needs and opportunities for data analysis and solutions
Create dashboards and self-service capabilities for stakeholders through analytics and reporting tools (Looker, Tableau, Google Sheets, etc.)
Identify trends, investigate drivers, and present findings to diverse stakeholders, articulating the "so what" by translating insights into strategic, actionable recommendations
Anticipate follow-up questions and incorporate them into analyses to address core problems, above and beyond the direct question
Serve as a thought partner to Emerging Business functional teams (1P Retail & Inside Sales, 3P Retail, Peloton for Business, Pre-Owned, etc.)
Collaborate with data engineers on the design and building of foundational datasets
Collaborate with finance teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency across reporting channels
Independently plan and prioritize work based on knowledge of strategic context for the team and company
YOU BRING TO PELOTON
6+ years of relevant analytical solutions or business intelligence experience
Expertise navigating large datasets
Expertise using business intelligence tools (Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Understanding of SQL, columnar databases, and distributed file systems
Ability to optimize queries and pipelines for efficient performance.
Expertise in identifying data trends, investigating drivers, and using insights to make strategic recommendations
Excellent data story-telling skills, through executive-level presentations in Google Slides
Experience applying statistical techniques to understand and quantify the relationships between metrics and differentiate between correlation and causation
Proven understanding of python, especially libraries and packages focused on data processing and analysis
Extremely detail-oriented and highly organized
