Job Description:
Cocoa Climate Sustainability Data Analyst
Mars has set science-based targets to reduce the company’s greenhouses gases (GHG) emissions (Scopes 1, 2 and 3) and to achieve net zero emissions by 2050. Cocoa is the largest category within the business and plays a major role in enabling Mars to achieve the net zero target. Mars Cocoa Enterprise (MCE) has been implementing several activities that contribute to this goal and has been working to integrate this fully in business processes. This needs to be accompanied by enhanced, transparent, and accessible greenhouse gases (GHG) data analytics.
The Cocoa Climate Sustainability Data Analyst will play a global role to support the Cocoa Climate Sustainability team in developing, deploying, and generating MCE performance data analytics across key topics and KPIs relevant to the climate agenda and to other impact areas. This work ensures the link between the delivery or our sustainability objectives and our visibility of the performance results, strengthening business decision-making, ensuring data and information is actionable for business leaders, and enabling lower-footprint innovation through improved systems and tools. This role is responsible for interpreting complex sustainability data to support improved decision-making processes that will enable the efficient contribution of MCE to Mars net zero target.
Role responsibilities include global sustainability data analysis and reporting, farm-level polygon analysis and integration into Mars systems, impact factor methodology development and carbon footprint tool support. The role requires technical knowledge in a range of sustainability areas, including geographic information system (GIS), life cycle assessment with a core focus on climate, as well as strong capabilities in quantitative data analysis and modeling and systems integration. The ideal candidate will be a data-driven, adaptable, critical thinker who can maintain collaborative cross-functional relationships with other Mars teams, with suppliers and consultants.
What are we looking for?
Degree in business, engineering, data science or a sustainability-related topic.
Minimum 3 years’ experience working in a quantitative data analysis field or discipline, with focus on environmental sustainability, life cycle assessment and GHG accounting.
Experience across data analysis software and systems (SimaPro, Excel, Power BI, Python, etc.).
Geographic information system (GIS) expertise.
Technical knowledge across sustainability topics including GHG accounting and life cycle assessment.
Working understanding of GHG accounting standards and practices.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Data storytelling skills.
Ability to work flexibly with global teams across different time zones.
Occasional travel may be required.
What will be your key responsibilities?
Data Analysis and Reporting
Lead the data analysis and scenario development for GHG accounting in MCE, adopting the full life cycle perspective that is needed in Scope 3 accounting and that is pertinent to MCE. Support tracking MCE climate-specific and other related sustainability performance to meet mainly internal and occasionally external reporting needs. This requires validating, collating and analyzing sustainability data across many continents to provide a comprehensive view of the MCE climate sustainability progress. This role is to engage with cross-functional stakeholders and will work to identify data gaps or issues to help work towards more streamlined and precise climate sustainability data management.
Farm-level Spatial Analysis
Lead farm-level spatial data analysis and integrate related outputs into Mars systems to reduce and report GHG emission reduction from achieving deforestation-free status, monitoring farm-level climate-smart practices and properly allocating emissions to cocoa. This requires, among others, ensuring polygon data received from our suppliers are complete and of high quality. This is to be in collaboration with other functions and with external service providers.
Impact Factor Development and Validation
Responsible for proposing new GHG impact factor methodologies and to help build a library of archetypes for supplier and origin-specific impact factor generation. These include generating impact factors specific to cocoa, considering different origins, agricultural practices, whilst considering carbon sinks and sources such as above and below ground carbon sequestration. This work entails drilling down on Life Cycle Assessment assumptions for cocoa in the World Food LCA Database and enhancing the data considering links between supply chain existing data and the overall impact factor estimates. This work is to be done in collaboration with Mars Inc. global sustainability team, and results are to be used for internal and external reporting.
Carbon Footprinting Tool Support
Support the development and use of a range of tools key for MCE’s ability to deliver on the climate goals over time, helping inform and shape choices and decisions, develop emissions scenarios and build on existing tools such as the Cool Farm Tool.
Making the links with other impact areas
This role will also leverage the existing and developing capabilities to deliver on climate targets to other impact areas, namely: land footprint, water stress and potentially also human rights targets.
What can you expect from Mars?
Work with over 130,000 diverse and talented Associates, all guided by the Five Principles.
Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

Job Summary
The Data Analyst will work as a member of Stifel’s Analyst team within the IT & Technology Product Development groups. The Data Analyst is responsible for servicing ad-hoc data extraction and reporting requests originating from various firm business areas including compliance or regulatory areas as well as product management. This position will be expected to interpret requests, work with business users to further define requirements, analyze pertinent underlying data to ensure proper use and then translate those requirements into queries that will provide the objective data sets. The Data Analyst will also be responsible for learning as much as possible about company applications and business practices in the context of how they affect the firm's data.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Field inbound requests from business users and/or related project development teams, and refine requirements until a full understanding is reached on the data being requested.
Build and leverage T-SQL queries that isolate data according to the business requirements gathered.
Perform limited due diligence on data produced to ensure quality and accuracy.
Maintain strong communication with stakeholders, following up as needed to ensure all requests are being actively addressed and/or status is being communicated.
Triage requests to focus first on more time-sensitive items.
Work according to standards and practices set by Product Management or senior team members.
Gain an understanding of company applications and business practices in the context of how they affect the firm's data.
Qualifications
Basic understanding of financial industry terminology and concepts.
Ability to leverage SQL to create queries which model and/or aggregate large complex datasets.
Understanding or willingness to learn basic concepts of Microsoft T-SQL and database design within first six months on job.
Strong analytical skills focused on using logic and reasoning to identify complex relationships within a data structure as well as to research and discuss recommended uses.
Ability to quickly adjust priorities, tasks, and deadlines based on severity and urgency of departmental and firm-goals.
Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Business Administration, or related field; or equivalent work experience required
1+ years' experience in the investment, financial, or technical field required
About Stifel
Stifel is a more than 130 years old and still thinking like a start-up. We are a global wealth management and investment banking firm serious about innovation and fresh ideas. Built on a simple premise of safeguarding our clients’ money as if it were our own, coined by our namesake, Herman Stifel, our success is intimately tied to our commitment to helping families, companies, and municipalities find their own success.
While our headquarters is in St. Louis, we have offices in New York, San Francisco, Baltimore, London, Frankfurt, Toronto, and more than 400 other locations. Stifel is home to approximately 9,000 individuals who are currently building their careers as financial advisors, research analysts, project managers, marketing specialists, developers, bankers, operations associates, among hundreds more. Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.
At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.

Introduction – Organizational Details:
Barilla America, Inc. wants to recruit a Supply Chain Data Analyst - within Supply Chain in Northbrook, IL. The individual will report to the Production & Distribution Planning Sr. Manager.

Job Purpose: The Supply Chain Data Analyst will problem solve and begin to predict for improved efficiencies in the data integrity throughout Supply Chain interfaces for Planning, Customer Orders, SAP, and Transportation (APO, SAP, EDI, E2Open) working in conjunction with IT and in alignment with global processes.


Key Accountabilities:
1. Confirm orders flow through without error from customers on a daily basis to ensure proper order-to-cash (OTC) data flows using internal customer (EDI) system.
2. Communicate with customers and partners in identifying EDI data issues and ensuring the cleaning of any bad records.
3. Ensure proper data flows for weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual planning cycles in APO tool and identify if trends occur for improvements.
4. Partner with IT on continuous improvement data projects to eliminate manual work, find efficiencies, and begin to use predictive models for data analysis.
5. Provide S.C. user support on Barilla America’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems and interfaces. (technical super-user).
6. Support the implementation of upcoming software changes for Forecasting, Planning, and Order Book Management (e.g. SAP/APO, Manugistics, etc.).
7. Provide user support for other Supply Chain tools and systems.
8. Develop relationships with the category business teams and manage expectations through deep knowledge of business processes, strategies, and goals.
9. Maintain excellent working relationships and healthy partnerships with business partners and external vendors.
10. Proactively monitor interfaces between business systems and resolve any issues.
11. Facilitate periodic meetings with business partners for project updates and issue resolution.
12. Proactively identify, escalate, and help resolve issues as they arise.
13. Document Business Processes and SOP.
14. Assist in developing process improvements that can be translated by IT to be put into system improvements.
15. Work with the Business Units to define initiatives and guidelines for business process innovation as a fundamental step towards business change.

Education/Work Experience:
Bachelor’s degree (Supply Chain Management, BBA in Business Analytics or BBA in logistics and supply chain management) or specialized training
Minimum 3 years of experience supporting Supply Chain data analysis, data flows and systems
3 years of SAP (ERP) support experience, APO preferred
Attention to detail and ability to troubleshoot data integrity issues on business processes
Experience using APO, EDI (Gentran preferred), and SAP (at least 1, multiple a plus)
E2Open or Transportation software experience preferred
Strong communication, interpersonal, and influencing skills
Ability to prioritize multiple tasks to ensure end-user satisfaction
Ability to be able to identify end-to-end processes and understand the effect of errors and changes on the overall downstream processes
Technical/functional experience a plus
Super user experience in supply chain and ERP systems
Experience working for a CPG or manufacturing company a plus.
Ability to travel domestically and internationally if needed, less than 5% travel

Description:
Summary The Meditech Clinical Analyst provides project management and coordinates patient care process design and reviews activities access for the organization to ensure maximum benefits and enhancements are functioning correctly. Formats, designs and builds relevant clinical content into appropriate workflows to provide end-users with knowledge at the point of care. This position is responsible for identifying areas at risk in coordination with the Manager of HIT.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Acts as a liaison for nurses, physicians and ancillary areas to translate clinical requirements into clinical systems.
Leads teams to implement new projects and systems.
Assists with process redesign and coordinates clinical workflow.
Assesses implementation strategies and the impact those strategies will have on workflows and operations.
Trains end-users on new or enhanced applications.
Ensures production clinical systems operate accurately, reliably and efficiently.
Researches and analyzes system performance and assists with improvement measures.
Provides support, performs root cause analysis and issues resolution for problems in all clinical applications. This includes after-hour maintenance and end user support as required.
Assists with ensuring adequate security measures and procedures are in place to maintain the confidentiality of the gathered data and distribution/access is only made to the appropriate, designated personnel.
Provides technical support, troubleshooting and problem resolution services to computer and telephone end-users.
Provides excellent customer service to resolve issues and maintains systems.
Produces and maintains systems documentation.
Assists with system upgrades.
Completes assignments with minimal supervision.
Requirements:
A Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science or related field is required; or equivalent experience.
Must have knowledge of all major storage protocols.
Ability to manage detailed tasks efficiently and effectively. Strong project management skills required.
Must have excellent customer service skills along with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast paced environment.
Excellent troubleshooting, root cause analysis and permanent problem resolution skills
Certificates, Licenses, Registrations
Experience in the installation of application development methodology and standards.

Interested in joining a winning team? A team whose employees are empowered to make a difference?
Compensation Grade: 31-32
Offer Range: $66,544 - $90,110
Location: Marina View Offices – League City, Texas
Organizational context and job purpose
INEOS Organization:
INEOS is a global manufacturer of petrochemicals, specialty chemicals and oil products. It comprises 17 businesses, each with a major chemical company heritage. Its production network spans 75 manufacturing facilities in 24 countries throughout the world.
Business Context:
The O&P USA business includes the product lines Ethylene, Propylene, Butadiene, Polypropylene and Polyethylene. Manufacturing sites include Chocolate Bayou Works (Alvin, TX), Battleground Manufacturing Complex (LaPorte, TX), and Carson (Carson, CA), with a division office in League City, TX.
How the Role Fits in:
The SAP application is the single-most critical component in our Financial and Supply Chain business processes. Unavailability of the SAP system can have a significant, direct, negative impact on business performance.. The role is necessary to ensure employees in the company can remain productive and business processes that rely on SAP and related technology continue to function. Problem solving done by the individual is limited to choosing from among multiple procedures fitting known patterns of problems.
The Main Purpose of the Role:
Provide Master Data Stewardship for SAP and its ancillary systems.
Responsibilities AND Accountabilities
Accountability 1:
Lead development and support of the business Master Data governance process for SAP.
Identify best practices and process improvements for data management based on investigation/analysis and solicited feedback
Incorporate process changes into appropriate audit and training materials.
Accountability 2:
The individual works with clearly defined objectives; and seeks clarification if needed;
Understands the value of procedures and policies and works within them; and seeks help and advice as required to meet timelines;
Applies general technical principles within well defined policies.
The employee is given priorities and may deviate from established procedures if directed to. Occasional direct monitoring of the job is typical.
Accountability 3:
Act as the primary link between the business stake holders and SAP functiona leads to transalate business master data requirement implementataion and ensure data integrity across the IT eco system.
The employee Influences the establishment of new procedures within their function to optimize performance.
Supports developing and sharing of best practices within the local organization.The individual determines priorities and may deviate from established procedures as long as objectives are met. No direct monitoring of the job.
Accountability 4:
Work with the business functional community and other process areas to investigate and resolve business process and data issues.
Assist with IT user training development and delivery.
Assist users with tools and support to allow them to effectively and accurately manage and retrieve their data.
Accountability 5:
Collaborate with the business process owners to foster a positive IT business relations environment
Work closely with 3rd party support vendors
Participates in System Cycle and Integration testing.
Skills & Knowledge Required
Education/Experience
Bachelors degree in Computer/Management Information Systems
3 years Chemicals Industry and SAP Experience
Technical skills
Understands technical aspects of role and performs work with minimal supervision
General business process background, with solid understanding of relevant SAP module
Experience in ERP data governance, data management
Understanding of complex database systems and management of large data sets
Able to diagnose and solve technical or process issues.
Behavioral skills
Able to work well with others, giving and receiving information willingly;
• Awareness of workplace diversity; Ability to work with colleagues.• Good communication skills (both written and verbal) and the ability to interact across different cultures and time zones.
Solves well defined problems without or with only partially defined steps to solutions in area of discipline.
Able to solve complex, but predictable, problems where solutions are known to exist within core discipline.
Shares information with others; organizes data; gathers information systematically; seeks input from others.
Our culture is one of honesty and integrity with an emphasis on safety, health and environmental performance.On our team, people are acknowledged for embracing new practices that help create real value for customers.

Proficient in Microsoft Excel


Proficient in SQL


Proficiency with Microsoft Power BI

The Enviva team is driven by our shared vision for a renewable energy future. We are a fast-growing, purpose-driven, global energy company specializing in delivering sustainable wood bioenergy solutions. We are the world’s largest producer of sustainable wood pellets, which provide a low-carbon alternative to fossil fuels.
Enviva is looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will have the chance to shape data analytics at Enviva and make a real impact on our organization. You will be responsible for working with stakeholders to drive decision-making and problem solving. The ideal candidate is highly motivated with strong quantitative and analytical skills, as well as a deep understanding of data and analytics. You should have experience working with a wide range of data sources, and an ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Previous experience in a data analyst role for a large organization is desirable.
Responsibilities
Data Collection & Analysis:
Extracting and aggregating data from multiple disparate sources including SQL, Azure DW/DL, and Excel
Ensuring data quality and integrity by cleaning and preprocessing the data.
Performing analysis to derive insights from the data.
Developing and applying data analysis techniques, including regression analysis, clustering, and classification.
Provide assistance with other ad hoc reporting requests
Data Visualization:
Creating visual representations of data using tools like charts, graphs, and dashboards.
Presenting data in a clear and understandable format for non-technical stakeholders.
Report Generation:
Gather, define and document business requirements and turn them into meaningful solutions for leadership audiences
Developing business driven reports, dashboards and data visualization using PowerBI including DAX.
Creating actionable recommendations based on data insights.
Automating reports for real-time self-service consumption
Data Modeling:
Building predictive models to forecast trends or outcomes.
Evaluating and fine-tuning models to improve their accuracy and performance.
Data Management:
Organizing and maintaining databases and data repositories.
Ensuring data security, privacy, and compliance with relevant regulations.
Communication and Collaboration:
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide data-driven insights.
Effective communication of findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Desire and ability to take ownership and drive programs successfully with minimal guidance or supervision.
Problem Solving:
Identifying business problems and using data analysis to propose solutions and make data-driven decisions.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Business, or related field
3+ years data-analytics experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, developing dashboards, and reporting results)
Advanced skills and experience developing business driven reports, dashboards and data visualization using PowerBI including DAX.
Experience extracting and aggregating data from multiple disparate sources including SQL, Azure DW/DL, and Excel
Experience automating reports for real-time self-service consumption
Strong background in data analysis, data validation and data quality assurance.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Proven ability to gather, define and document business requirements and turn them into meaningful solutions for leadership audiences
Ability to pivot to provide assistance with other ad hoc reporting requests
Strong analytical, critical thinking, and organizational skills
Excellent written and verbal communication and documentation skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Office
Proactive, customer-service oriented approach in engaging with stakeholders
Preferred Qualifications - What Will Set You Apart
Desire and ability to take ownership and drive programs successfully with minimal guidance or supervision.
Strong aptitude and curiosity for technology to enable understanding of relevant data to help develop business insights and/or identify significant anomalies
Experience/proficiency with project management software such as Cora and Smartsheet is preferred
Travel requirements
Minimal, as required
Working Conditions
Hybrid work with a minimum of three days a week in the office and the ability to work two days a week from home.

Remote Part-time Data/Quantitative Research Position
APPLY

Remote Part-time Data/Quantitative Research Position ($40-$50/hour)

We are looking to hire someone to work with us on our 2024 US Presidential Electoral College forecast. Our 2020 forecast, conducted more than 100 days prior to the election, correctly predicted the 2020 vote outcome in every state but one. The person hired will be invited to co-author on published work from the project. The position can be remote.

Key responsibilities include downloading and cleaning relevant public opinion and economic data, merging data, estimating Multilevel Regression with Poststratification (MRP) models, generating tables and figures, and (if desired), helping write up results.

The position will begin in January or early February and extend through August. We expect it will require approximately 10 to 20 hours/week, though there can be some flexibility from week-to-week if desired.

The work involved is at the level of a social science PhD with specialization in quantitative methods, but there are no formal degree requirements. We recognize that multiple paths exist to data and statistical software expertise. This position might be a particularly good fit for recent PhDs, students completing a PhD, or individuals with strong data skills considering a PhD. We encourage anyone with relevant skills and experience to apply.

Required
Familiarity with Stata and R and extensive experience/expertise with at least one of these
Excellent attention to detail
Excellent written and in-person communication
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
Strongly preferred
Project management experience
Experience cleaning, merging, and/or working with numerous and/or complex datasets
Research experience with MRP models and/or statistical prediction and uncertainty modelling
To apply: For full consideration, submit the following as attachments by Monday, December 11, 2023. Applications will be reviewed until the position is filled.
CV or resume
Cover letter clearly indicating why you are interested in the position, evidence of required and strongly preferred criteria/skills (please list each criterion/skill in bold before providing evidence), and references who can speak to your skills and experiences (letters of reference will not be considered at this point).
The project team includes:

Peter Enns
Professor of Government and Professor of Public Policy, Cornell University
Co-founder and Chief Data Scientist, Verasight

Julius Lagodny
Data Analyst, El Pato
Research Fellow, Hertie School Data Science Lab

Health Data Analyst
Med-Pediatrics - Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh - (23008834)

Equivalent relevant work experience may be substituted for degree requirement. PA Child Abuse History Clearance, PA State Police Criminal Record Check, and FBI Criminal Record Check will be required prior to the start of employment. Also, a current TB test will be required as a condition of employment. EEO/AA/M/F/Vets/Disabled.

Job Summary
Compiles and performs more complex statistical analysis on multiple-source healthcare data to assess utilization, control costs, and care indicators and measurement utilizing complex data-mining, statistical, and advanced modeling techniques in data interpretation. Writes in-depth data analysis reports for multiple projects and for leadership. Identifies data problem areas, conducts research to determine best course of action, and provides innovative ways (e.g., predictive analysis) to use existing data to improve program outcomes.
Essential Functions
Compiles and performs more complex statistical analysis on healthcare data based on team and/or leadership requests to assess utilization, control costs, and care indicators and measurement.
Applies complex data-mining, statistical, and advanced modeling techniques in data interpretation.
Facilitates coordination of healthcare data from multiple sources including, but not limited to, medical claims, medical records, and lab results. Ensures accuracy of data.
Writes timely and accurate in-depth data analysis reports for multiple projects and for leadership requests; details conclusions, and identifies data trends.
Interprets data to assess clinical plans, programs, and provider effectiveness with insight into financials and patient outcomes.
Monitors and identifies data problem areas and conducts research to determine best course of action. Provides innovative ways to use existing data to improve program outcomes and efficiencies, including predictive analytics.
Evaluates and recommends improvements, tracks implementation usages, and tracks progress/decline of data sets. Assists projects sponsors with relevant data sets.
Assists in data preparation and findings for journals and publications.
Maintains databases; inputs data and statistical findings in a timely and accurate manner.
Some travel to satellite sites may occur. If not utilizing public transportation, a valid driver’s license is required. It is the expectation that the incumbent will use their own vehicle required for local travel and the owner of the vehicle must carry automobile liability insurance. The owner’s automobile liability insurance coverage is primary coverage. The University’s automobile liability insurance policy provides excess coverage only.
Physical Effort
Light.

Position Summary:
The Programmer / Data Analyst position is part of the Decision Support Team and supports the organization's data driven management strategies. This position is responsible for pulling and analyzing health care data, including HCC and RAF scores. Data mining, manipulation of data using Excel and high level critical thinking are essential job functions. This position may also provide programming support in the form of SQL coding, Access database development and maintenance, Tableau dashboard creation and deployment of reports using SSRS.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:
Extract and analyze data with SQL scripts
Manipulate and interpret data using Excel and Access
Analyze data on key health care metrics such an HCC, RAF scores, enrollment growth and utilization of services
Decode end user report requests into SQL specifications
Communicate effectively with all levels of the organization
Be responsive to end-user requests for customization of existing reports
Work collaboratively with fellow team members
Create dashboards for presentation to the Executive Team
Develop user friendly database solutions in Microsoft Access
Develop and support Tableau Dashboards
Develop reporting solutions using SSRS
Support the library of Crystal Reports
Take ownership of assigned projects and deadlines
All other duties as directed by management
The pay range for this position at commencement of employment is expected to be between $112,065.20 - $115,000 annually; however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, licensure, skills, and experience.
The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a sign-on bonus and discretionary awards in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits, such as vacation, sick time, and parental leave), dependent on the position offered.
Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.
If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

Career Area:
Business Technologies, Digital and Data
Job Description:
Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.
When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.
Big machines require big thinking. Are you looking for your next big challenge?

Cat® Digital is the digital and technology arm of Caterpillar Inc., leveraging the latest technologies to build industry leading digital solutions for our customers and dealers. With over 1.4 million connected assets worldwide, our teams use data, technology, advanced analytics, telematics and AI capabilities to help our customers build a better, more sustainable world.
Working with a Fortune 100 leader, you can build your career on a global scale and take advantage of development opportunities with emerging technologies. We’ve created an inclusive environment for you to explore your passions, make an impact and do the work that really matters. Join Us.
JOB PURPOSE:
The Aftermarket Sales & Opportunity Management team of Cat Digital is hiring! We need a Business Data Analyst to support the latest digital product in Caterpillar’s Aftermarket Leads and Insights department utilizing technology to bring actionable data quality insights to our dealers. Will you embrace the challenge?
Coordinate enterprise aftermarket growth through representing and/or deploying a specific platform or group of capabilities of Caterpillar’s world class digital product solutions with our enterprise, industry and/or Dealer partners. Support appropriate partners in deploying digital capabilities, focusing on delivering customer and business value as defined in a variety of ways, typically in the form of online leads, attributable sales, parts sales and support activities – the full customer lifecycle. Proactively seek to understand the marketing and business objectives of appropriate partners and help coordinate with capability experts on how, when and where capabilities can be best utilized to drive value.
JOB RELATED STATISTICS:
Platform Complexity: Moderate
Scope: 1-2 Platforms or industry groups
Global Geographic Scope
JOB DUTIES:
A Business Data Analyst typically deploys 1 to 2 platforms and/or capabilities (or equivalent based on size, scope and complexity) with strong technical knowledge of the digital product capabilities and regions they support.
Supports appropriate team members in driving and/or deploying digital execution within the framework of aftermarket enterprise tools, processes and strategies. Helps manage and organize appropriate information, dashboards, metrics and other reports for team members to use with their partners. Supports digital projects that identify linkages and synergies across business units, industries and/or Dealers.
Supports proper collaboration, coordination, training, communication and alignment among related areas, projects and strategies within the team and with internal and/or Dealer partners. Reinforces digital awareness through communication and identity programs in global regions and multiple business units, industry groups and/or Dealers. This role will help coordinate materials and efforts necessary to convey and execute digital strategy. Supports future-focused assessment of global and industry impact related to digital programs and deployments, and helps other consultants coordinate efforts.
Completes complex data analysis related to user support, aftermarket product segmentation analysis and business requirements for product enhancement projects
Assists other consultants in coordinating efforts and/or gathers information to solve issues and problems requiring careful analysis and diagnosis. Proactively seeks to develop personal digital acumen.
Tracks and monitors progress, typically via metrics reporting. Other job duties assigned as needed.
Key competencies for role are Composure, Learning Quickly, Listening, Planning, Process Management, Self-Development and Communication.
Some travel may be required (less than 10% of working time)
Basic Qualifications:
Requires 1- 4+ years of job-related experience, typically in eBusiness, digital products, digital marketing, technical marketing, marketing communications, or digital analytics.
A college or university degree or equivalent experience is required.
2+ years of project coordinating, including basic communication and change management planning is also required.

Job Description:
The Role
The Data Analyst works closely with business and technical teams to drive the creation of scalable and documented data design solutions. They drive adoption of enterprise and industry standard modeling methodologies. They partner with project teams to deliver practical & resilient data model designs that meet business needs and are capable of easily adapting to future business requirements.
The Expertise and Skills You Bring
Primary Responsibilities
Requirements and Analysis
Engage with business and technology partners to understand the business requirements, analyze data gaps, and recommend appropriate solutions.
Assess objectives, use cases, data requirements and specifications documents created by other analysts
Analyze and resolve major data issues that arise during the course of projects or in production environments
Data Design
You are an experienced enterprise data modeler who can define conceptual and logical data models, with strong definitions, to assemble organizational data needs across multiple subject areas
Create physical design from logical data models for different types of systems such as operational systems, data warehouses, data lakes and others
Research to identify effective data designs, new tools and methodologies for data analysis
Document and present database solutions to product partners for approval.
Promote common data API adoption and reuse.
Map Technical terms to Business terms in data catalog tool.
Technical Leadership
Ensure technology decisions align with enterprise standards and strategy.
Collaborate with DBAs, architects, subject area owners to create scalable data models.
Find opportunities to apply enterprise data model for new projects to minimize work and data duplication
Qualifications
Education and Experience (dependent on level)
A Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent experience
5+ years’ experience with data design, analysis and development. Development experience weighted towards PL/SQL and data loading tool/concepts.
Demonstrated experience in the following areas : Data API design and implementation, PL/SQL, data warehouses, data modeling and data profiling.
Skills and Knowledge
Demonstrable experience with SAP Power Designer or similar data modeling tool.
Proficient analytical and problem solving skills
Solid understanding of the database development process including analysis, design, coding, testing, problem resolution and planning, and full competency in all relevant coding environments, languages, tools, and platforms
Good interpersonal skills and strong verbal and written skills to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical associates in the company
Proven interpersonal skills, including the ability to work across the organization and interact/influence/negotiate optimally at all levels of management and peers.
Experience working in cross-functional agile development teams.
Understanding of Financial Services.
The Team
Asset Management Technology is seeking a Senior level candidate in the analysis and data modeling organization. The successful candidate will be responsible for leading analysis and data modeling across different projects with diverse scope and complex business and technical requirements in a highly integrated data environment. This role requires working under experienced leaders, for achieving organizational strategic data goals. You must be comfortable working in a fast paced and highly ambiguous agile environment where there is a focus on timely delivery of data models and other data artifacts.
Certifications:
Company Overview
Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients' money.

Join Us
At Fidelity, you'll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples' lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees' Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a Best Place to Work in 2023. And you don't need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you've always imagined.
At Fidelity, our goal is for most people to work flexibly in a way that balances both personal and business needs with time onsite and offsite through what we’re calling “Dynamic Working”. Most associates will have a hybrid schedule with a requirement to work onsite at a Fidelity work location for at least one week, 5 consecutive days, every four weeks. These requirements are subject to change.
We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.

Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.
Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations @fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.
At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.

Seer Interactive is a digital marketing consultancy that harnesses compassion, data, and technology to make a mark on our communities - our coworkers, our clients, our industry, and our neighbors. We believe in relentlessly pursuing (and sharing) the truth – bringing together millions of data points from quantitative and qualitative sources to base our decisions on. Our purpose is to unlock potential for our communities mentioned above. Our vision is a world where it’s easy to do the right thing throughout those communities. If you’re ready to uplift others, challenge your ego, commit to the truth, and be better than yesterday – keep reading.

Seer is a remote first agency with team members working across the country. If an office environment is more your style, this position can also sit in Philadelphia or San Diego.

What about you? You're a natural-born consultant who loves solving problems at scale and making recommendations that are rooted in data- Big Data. What's better than bringing together millions of data points from disparate data sets to identify empathy-fueled opportunities for your clients? Communicating them in a way that gets clients excited, on-board, and eager to work together. You are data-driven, love a good challenge, and keep a close pulse on paid social industry updates to ensure we’re using the appropriate tools and ad types to help our clients achieve their goals. You take your client's success personally. Treating their bottom line with heart and protecting each dollar as if it were your own- and your clients love you for it! (We do too!!)

Your compensation and benefits will look like...
$75,000-$90,000/annually
Evaluation of comp at least once a year
Profit Sharing
Benefits that support your whole self
Snippets of our highlighted benefits: (not comprehensive)
Recharge week: 1 week PTO before starting
Unlimited PTO with a 3 week minimum/year requirement and Flexible Fridays
Reduced Holiday Hours from Christmas through New Year’s for the whole team to unplug and recharge
13 paid company holidays, including Employee Appreciation Days & Mental Health Days
100% paid parental leave to support your growing family with phased return
Elected Medical, Dental & Vision benefits effective your first day with employer funded employee premiums, HRA and Dental
If you enroll in our medical plan, a medical HRA to support your individual / family deductible
All Access HRA annual allowance to support your health & wellness
Annual Kaizen budget for your professional development
Company funded Mental Health support via Ginger
401k at 1 year, 100% vested with a generous match and company funded financial advisor available day 1
Flexible working schedule with core business hours in your timezone
Joining us 100% remotely? You’ll receive a $400 Remote Office setup stipend to set up your workspace
Here are some highlights of what you'll be doing...
Craft and drive Paid Social strategy through an integrated approach to Search. Leveraging your expertise across a variety of paid channels (Paid Search, Paid Social, Display, Programmatic, and more!) and collaborating closely with SEO, Analytics & Creative to help grow your clients' bottom line
Build strong, lasting relationships with your clients using Seer's values as your compass. You treat each touchpoint as an opportunity to build depth and trust in your relationship
- learning about the business, their goals, new opportunities, and how their day is going
Oversee day-to-day campaign strategy & management, acting as a champion for big data and making keyword recommendations at scale. You'll ensure analyses and client recommendations are, at the very least, rooted in both paid and organic data
- supporting audience research, ad copy and asset creation, landing page recommendations/testing, and performance analysis along the way
Prepare and lead presentations for your clients that demonstrate your impact and value on their bottom line. You're the tried-and-true business partner that client's dream of; positioning yourself as an extension of their team, and treating their wins/losses as your own
The skills you'll bring to the table...
You've managed Paid Social campaigns across a wide range of engines (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, and Pinterest) plus have experience with management platforms (Sprout, Sprinklr, Marin, and/or Kenshoo social)
You're no newbie to the world of automation. You know when & where to get precious time back by using big data, automation, machine learning so you can keep growing your skills!
You thrive on a challenge
- rolling up your sleeves to take risks with innovation and testing; you’ve got hands-on experience running campaigns and it’s made you the subject matter expert you are today
Even though this role is Paid Social focused, you feel comfortable with cross channel management; specifically in Paid Search
Paid Social may be your thing, but you know it takes a data-driven, holistic approach to drive success for your clients. You're all about channel integration and leveraging data from SEO, Paid Search and Analytics to build smarter Paid Social strategies. You may not have all the answers, but you know where to go and who to ask
You know the world of Social changes fast and it excites you! You're all over the latest emerging trends, tools, technologies, and data sets. You see the future of Machine Learning and AI in Social. You stay on top of new and evolving targeting options and ad formats. You bring fresh ideas to the table and fearlessly run alongside industry changes. You're quick to kick up a new opportunity and run with it, making data-driven, actionable recommendations to drive value for your clients
Your passion for Paid Social stretches beyond reading industry blogs, articles, and case studies. You use your knowledge to elevate your clients, colleagues and industry peers
- through 1:1s, Lunch 'n Learns, webinars, blogs, case studies, and speaking engagements. Facebook Blueprint certified too? Awesome!
Your skills stretch beyond Paid Social
- you're savvy with Excel, Google Suite, data viz tools and you have an A+ in data literacy. You understand data sources and constructs, the basics of SQL, and more! Most importantly, you know when there's an opportunity at your fingertips and are quick to loop-in the resident Data Analyst & Engineer to make it a reality
Your most important qualities to be successful at Seer...
Truth Seeker
Innovative
Humble
Data Driven
People Centric
Authentic

Not ready to apply but want to keep in touch? Stay connected via our monthly Career Update newsletter! We'll share curated content on Seer, open roles, industry insights, career advice, events you don't want to miss, and more (so you never miss a beat).

You enjoy creating and innovating. You never stop striving for better. You take responsibility and you get results. You love being part of a team. Above all, you want your work to matter: Welcome to our world! At Sonova we create sense by bringing sound to life. Our innovative hearing care solutions help millions of people enjoy life’s unforgettable moments.
We offer exceptional career opportunities through market-leading brands from consumer to medical, products and services that keep pushing hearing care forward, and a culture where you can quickly belong and perform at your best.
If you want the freedom to explore, opportunities to grow, and make positive change on people lives through your work, this is the place for you.

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst in the US to join a new team within the Marketing organization that is focused on lead generation. This role will currently report to the Senior Manager Data Analytics. You will be part of a fast-growing team within a larger corporate structure where you will have the opportunity to have a major impact on our ambitious growth path.
As Data Analyst you help to set the basis of a strong reporting in PowerBI and enable business stakeholders to leverage its full potential. You provide visibility of the unit’s business performance and facilitate easier decision making. With the mindset of a solution provider, you assess business requirements and derive actionable insights by using data analytics tools and processes.
Tasks
Design, build and manage a suite of reports used by the stakeholders from different teams on a daily basis. The reporting platform shall contain standardized metrics, covering all areas from lead generation, customer engagement, product adoption, sales, as well as marketing initiatives performance.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand and maintain focus on their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics, KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers.
Evaluate data sources and coordinate their integration into the database.
Set standards with regards to data visualization, building state-of-the-art BI solutions.
Ensure collaboration within Sonova’s group companies by demonstrating the importance of data-driven decision making.
Perform independent ad-hoc analyses and comprehensive data deep-dives to answer relevant business questions.
(Help) define relevant KPIs and tracking parameters to measure business performance more efficiently.
Clean, filter data and integrate datasets to be used for analyses and reporting.
Help stakeholders and provide solutions on data-related topics.
Present your analyses to relevant audiences.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Business Administration or related field
3+ years of experience as a Data analyst with strong SQL knowledge for query development and data modelling
Hands-on experience in reporting, building interactive visualizations and data analysis
Experience with one of the following data visualization tools: PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik, Looker, etc.
Solid understanding of data pipeline development end-to-end (ETL-workflows)
Experience in marketing analytics is a plus
Fluent in English
Experience with R or Python is considered a nice to have
Our offer
We offer you an opportunity to grow and develop in an open and international culture, with flat hierarchies and ample support for further training and development. Take on more responsibility, work in an excellent workplace, and enjoy attractive employment conditions (401k match, full healthcare coverage, generous PTO), all while having the flexibility to choose the working time model that works best for you.
Our Senior Recruiter, Marcus Straube-Minkwitz, is looking forward to your application and to speak with you about how you can be a valuable asset to our company. Apply today and take the first step in enhancing your career.

Boston, MA

We need your help.
We’re looking for a self-starting and driven Data Analyst to join the Decision Point Client Analytics team. Most of us are Boston-based, but you don’t have to be. This opportunity will enable you to contribute to the Decision Point mission by helping our healthcare customers make data-driven decisions. In this role, you will transform complex data into actionable information will inform health insurance and healthcare provider organizations on how to best target, engage, and empower their patient-members to make better health decisions.
There are three main areas of focus as a member of the Decision Point Client Analytics team, which is comprised of analysts and analytic consultants. The first is to work with the Decision Point Customer Success team to build customized reports and strategic recommendations. The second is to assist the Product team in the buildout of data analytics and reporting capabilities for our product offering. The third is to assist the Data Operations and Data Science team in preparing data for modeling. The right candidate will join other Decision Point team members that are passionate, hard-working, and eager to learn on a path for career growth. This position reports to the Vice President, Client Analytics.
The position:

Convert data into usable information that is easy to understand
Investigate data to find patterns and trends
Analyze data to assist in delivering recommendations to clients
Assist in the development of reports, data dictionaries, and presentations
Communicate analytic insights to team members
Become an expert in clients’ unique data
Understand data storage and data sharing methods
Ensure team maintains high standards of data management
Ensure quality control procedures and documentation management are followed
You’ll use your:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Computer Science, or related field
Background or interest in healthcare and health insurance quality and operations
Experience with SQL, SAS, R, Python, or any coding language. You will use your experience, or eagerness to learn, to write advanced SQL queries that span multiple data sources to develop business reports
Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Analytical mindset with good problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Good interpersonal skills
Familiarity with machine learning, statistical or financial modeling a plus
Experience with data visualization tools a plus

We are a rapidly growing healthcare technology company changing the fundamentals of patient and provider engagement. For years, health plans have relied on descriptive data and reactive engagement. We empower our clients to understand and predict the whole member journey, enabling sustained improvements in member health outcomes and plan performance. We combine the latest, most practical technologies and a deep understanding of healthcare, bringing innovative, pragmatic solutions to an industry that touches us all.

Assists with automating regular reports. Identifies trends in the data that will be useful in making organizational changes.

The Data Analyst’s primary duties will be to perform Python programming for simulations of the state's public school finance system. The position will also support the budget analyst responsible for the state’s public school finance system; respond to related ad hoc data requests; and perform other fiscal, policy, and data analyses to support the work of the Legislature.

This position reports to the Manager of the Public Education Team and works closely with other data analysts on the Public Education Team. The position works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

Essential Responsibilities
Assist with the maintenance and deployment of the data and technical systems that comprise the school finance model.
Conduct quality assurance procedures to produce accurate and complete work products.
Complete ad hoc requests and analyses in Excel to be distributed to a variety of audiences.
Communicate effectively by adequately simplifying and translating complex data and providing high level summaries and options for a variety of audiences. Use language appropriate for audience.
Assist with the development and implementation of Public Education Policy reports.
Communicate effectively with a variety of audiences including, but not limited to LBB staff and management, and agency personnel.
Coordinate and collaborate with other LBB analysts on budget, performance, and revenue issues, as appropriate.
Work collaboratively with other teams to effectively support legislative deliberations and agency success.
Contribute to or complete additional assignments that meet agency or legislative needs.
Essential Attributes and Skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Knowledge of Legislative function, procedures, and public administration practices.
Skill in using logic and reasoning to identify strengths, weaknesses and solutions.
Skill in using existing technology for research and presentation.
Skill in developing and maintaining data and technical systems.
Ability to establish goals and objectives and devise solutions to administrative problems.
Ability to effectively engage team members and encourage interpersonal relationships.
Ability to work on computers for extended periods of time.
Ability to plan, think ahead, and anticipate problems.
Ability to research and develop expertise in team-specific topics.
Ability to maintain objectivity and express ideas without bias.
Ability to maintain confidential and sensitive information.
Skill in maintaining confidentiality and objectivity, using sound reasoning to determine course of action.
Skill in listening and responding appropriately in a variety of settings.

Attributes Required of Every LBB Employee
Embrace agency mission/core values and follow policies, procedures, and processes.
Work effectively with LBB management and staff, as well as all external customers.
Coordinate, collaborate and employ good interpersonal skills; demonstrate positive outlook.
Balance concurrent projects, work under pressure, and adapt to changing priorities/deadlines.
Act with motivation, organization, and attention to details; complete tasks with an appropriate level of independence.
Be punctual and have regular attendance.
Work overtime on nights, weekends, and holidays, as necessary to meet agency deadlines.

Education and Experience
Minimum Qualifications
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university.
Familiarity with Python.
Experience in Excel with demonstrable intermediate proficiency.
Preferred Qualifications
A graduate degree preferred but not required.
Experience in the field of public education, especially with the Texas public school finance system, preferred, but not required.
Ability to learn to update and maintain the team website using beginner level HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

To apply for this position, you may apply directly through the posting selected on our website, which will redirect you to NeoGov or go to website https://www.governmentjobs.com/js_login.cfm. Responsibilities:
Related is looking for an experienced HR professional to join our dynamic team as the HR Reporting & Data Analyst. Enable HR to proactively identify trends and needs within the business. Create operational efficiencies by leveraging various HR technology solutions in HR Operations, Payroll, time and attendance, engagement, compensation, benefits, talent acquisition, onboarding, performance management and learning management.

ABOUT YOU

Our ideal candidate enjoys communicating to others and showcasing the value HR data adds to the organization. You approach business leaders, key stakeholders and peers as clientele. You have a mission driven view of tasks and responsibilities. You search to understand the key business questions and build deliverable metrics designed to answer these questions. You survey your audience and know when to be a storyteller and when to forecast models.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Create or collect complex data sets from a variety of sources and use statistics to analyze for trends and patterns

Responsible for understanding and analyzing data within HR systems and downstream system impacts: Ariba, Concur, Cornerstone, JD Edwards Enterprise One, iCims, HR Acuity, Hyperion, Qualtrics, UKG Pro
Report management: build and manage BI reports, SQL reports, standard reports, report scheduling
Work closely with key IT resource and provide back up support as needed

$80,000 - $100,000 / year
Annual performance based bonus
Qualifications:
Creating Analytics/Reporting Experience:
UKG Pro Cognos BI - Minimum 3 years
MS SQL Queries - Minimum 1 year
Advanced Excel – Charts, Formulas and Pivot Tables (VBA a plus)
Advanced MS PowerPoint
Bachelor Degree in HR / Business or related field (Master's Degree a plus)
Demonstrated ability to deliver sound, clear advice in a business setting
Demonstrated ability to be self-directed
Demonstrated data retrieval with automation processes and workflows
Demonstrated team player, leadership and client relationship skills; willing to be hands on
Excellent written and verbal communication skills required

Job Posting Title
Research Associate/Data Analyst
Job Description Summary
Admin Non-Exempt
Job Description
The Research Associate/Data Analyst will primarily provide analytical support to the Director of the Youth, Media, and Wellbeing Research Lab (YMW) at the Wellesley Centers for Women (WCW), Wellesley College. Our research involves quantitative and qualitative studies of adolescent and young adult social media and televised media use, socioemotional health, physical health, peer and romantic relationships, digital citizenship, election attitudes, and civic engagement. We are committed to an intersectional identity approach, exploring questions of race/ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, class, etc. We use a variety of methods to collect data in schools and community organizations, as well as through online platforms. We collect surveys, conduct interviews and focus groups, and social media content data of adolescents and young adults. Since 2013, we have collected multiple waves of cross-sectional survey data from over 25 countries related to gender equity and election attitudes from over 5000 individuals. Our recent NIH grant about adolescent social technology use amassed 5 waves of survey data from over 1500 middle and high school students in the Northeast. Locally, we also evaluate a summer workshop each year with approximately 25 youth using pre-/post-surveys. Another line of research that our lab conducts is the role of pets in adolescent development and technology use, which is a collaboration with Tufts University Cummings School of Veterinary Medicine.
The Research Data Analyst works collaboratively with our Project Coordinator, YMW Research Lab members, and with a doctoral-level statistical consultant, under the general direction of the Director. This RA’s primary role will be as the lab’s Quantitative Data Manager, which will involve co-developing recruitment and data collection procedures; creating, launching, and pilot testing Qualtrics surveys; data management (e.g., cleaning, confidential storage and documentation of identifiable data); and mentoring Wellesley College students on a variety of data analysis projects. Our quantitative data analysis will involve cross-sectional and longitudinal surveys, the latter which will require careful matching of participants from wave to wave. Data analysis may include recoding of variables, conducting reliability and validity statistics of study measures, quantifying qualitative data, and visualizing findings for academic presentations. The Data Analyst will maintain a library of relevant measures for past, current, and future studies. For grant proposals and funder reporting, the Data Analyst will prepare and summarize preliminary findings for the specific topic, including charts and tables depicting key highlights/insights using SPSS, Excel, Tableau, or similar programs. For manuscripts, the Data Analyst will draft and revise the Methods and Results section as needed.
In addition to the data analysis, the Research Associate will also provide administrative, logistical, and technical support as needed. Depending on the prior experiences and expertise of the candidate, these tasks may include collaborating with the Project Coordinator, Communications, and Technology teams to assist with quantitative and qualitative data collection, generating study content for website, creating infographics for the lab and WCW social media accounts, copyediting/formatting of manuscripts into the journal style (e.g., APA, AMA), and/or assisting with Institutional Review Board applications. Opportunities to publish in peer-reviewed journals and present at local and national conferences are available. Because this is a liberal arts teaching/learning lab, the data analyst will also work with multiple Wellesley College student research assistants.
This position is a grant-funded, 60% (21.0 hours/week) position with full benefits. Desired schedule would be part-time 3-4 days a week to be negotiated between 9-6pm. This is a term position for 3 years but may be extended beyond that date. Possibility of increasing time up to 80% (28 hours) during temporary peak grant periods, depending on availability and funding.
Experience Required
Candidates must have a master’s degree or a bachelor’s degree and 1-2 years experience in a social science research setting.
Fluency in SPSS and/or R.
Familiarity with survey platforms (e.g., Qualtrics).
Skills/Abilities/Competencies:
Positive outlook and enthusiasm for the research mission– enjoys working on a team with diverse people with various project roles (students, methodologists, research scientists at WCW, colleagues and postdocs at other institutions, consultants, pet lovers, etc.)
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of cross-functional teams, including the ability to work effectively both remotely and in person.
Excellent interpersonal skills, patience, and openness to constructive feedback
Good written communication skills (e.g., email correspondence, academic writing) and careful attention to detail
Ability to multitask, use good judgment to prioritize and follow through on work assignments
Proactive creative problem solver
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Flexibility and intellectual curiosity to work on multiple, varying, fast-paced projects
High degree of computer and internet literacy (e.g., Word, Excel, Google Docs, PowerPoint, social media)
Experience with manuscript preparation, foundation and federal grant applications, and recruitment of study participants preferred
Familiarity with academic reference formatting (e.g. APA, AMA, etc.)
Knowledge of protection of human subjects in behavioral research (or motivated to learn)
Experience with mixed methods and/or qualitative methods and NVivo a plus
Other
Available to work occasional nights and weekends as required to support grant deadlines or special events.
This is a flexible hybrid position. Schedule will depend on project needs and be decided on with the Director.
The Wellesley Centers for Women (WCW) is an academic research and action institute at Wellesley College that is focused on women and gender and driven by social change. The mission of WCW is to advance gender equality, social justice, and human wellbeing through high-quality research, theory, and action programs. As such, we encourage our employees to practice a good work/life balance.

CalPERS seeks an Research Data Analyst I (RDA I) within the Health Policy and Benefits Branch (HPBB), HPBB oversees the health benefits program for CalPERS which provides health coverage for members and their families. The Health Plan Research and Administration (HPRA) develops policy for the CalPERS health benefits program using data and information on market trends and best practices, facilitates the development of the CalPERS Strategic Plan for health, and monitors health-related legislation.

In addition, HPRA conducts health care cost and utilization research, provides analytical support for CalPERS annual health plan premium negotiations, and coordinates management information services for the CalPERS health benefits program. Job Purpose
Intercontinental Exchange is looking for a Reference Data Specialist to join our Reference Data Operations team based in New York, The primary purpose of this position is to support the team by providing subject matter expertise on all ESG matters. The candidates primary responsibility will be to analyze and interpret various ESG data sets, conduct thematic analysis of ESG content, consolidate results and relate findings to management. You will make recommendations pertaining to content development and methodology based on market trends, disclosure frameworks, and ESG bests practices. You will liaise and collaborate with various stakeholders such as our training team, business analysts, data quality and customer support to improve the quality, completeness, timeliness, and breadth of the ESG data set. You will conduct detailed mapping exercises linking ICE ESG data set to other ESG frameworks.
The fixed income and equities market consists of over 35 million active securities and the reference data provided by ICE Fixed Income & Data Services is used by our clients to make trading decisions, settle trades, make investment decisions, manage portfolios, analyze risk, create security master files, create client statements and conduct other back-office functions. Our reference data is also used by internal stakeholders such as the Evaluated Pricing, Index and Analytics groups which play an integral role in determining evaluated prices, determining whether or not a security should be added to or deleted from an index or indices, the weighted average of a security within an index and, performing a series of analytical calculations that are used both internally within ICE and externally by these stakeholders clientele.
Responsibilities
Maintain relationships with company investor relations or similar contact.
Collect, organize, and maintain company contact information (Name, position, e-mail, phone number).
Identify oddities within reporting; published outliers, and strange reporting techniques (not in line with recommended reporting standards)
Conduct proactive outreach to address issues with reporting/disclosure.
Conduct proactive outreach to confirm company disclosure/reports.
Develop and maintain appropriate communication materials (ie. emails, letters, scripts)
Operate proactive communication channels including but not limited to e-mails, phone calls, meetings etc.
Maintain records/data set documenting corporate communication and responses
Address and implement any data changes due to corporate engagement.
Knowledge and Experience
BA/BS in Finance, Economics, or equivalent practical experience
Minimum 2 years of ESG experience focused on data and methodology
Understanding or experience reporting under ESG frameworks, including but not limited to SASB (ISSB), CDP and TCFD
Excellent computer skills, including Excel, Word, Power Point, with the ability to manage, interpret, and report on highly fragmented, often voluminous data.
Strong communication skills as well as the ability to articulate complex strategies and ESG related terms for a generalist audience
Ability to work in a fast paced, high pressured, fluid environment
Ability to distill large amounts of varied information into specific takeaways
Excellent attention to detail and high degree of demonstrated decision-making and problem-solving skills
Strong analytical skills
Eagerness to learn and collaborate with others
Schedule
This role offers work from home flexibility of up to 2 days per week.
Base Salary Range for New York Candidates
The expected base salary for this role is between 60,000 - 80,000 USD. The base salary range does not include Intercontinental Exchanges incentive compensation. While we provide this range as general guidance, at ICE we compensate employees based on the skillset and experience of the individual.
Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or ancestry, age, disability or veteran status, or other protected status.

Job Title: Public Health Data Analyst - Vaccination Unit
Job Description:
Description:
Company: Lantana Consulting Group provides services and software for standards-based health information exchange. We have built our expertise through nearly two decades of development and deployment of technical specifications and interoperability solutions. As a distributed company with no single brick and mortar office, Lantana can hire the best available talent and offer a flexible work schedule. We are a small, growing business on a path towards employee ownership.
Primary purpose: Provide consulting, design, training, analytic and development services to Lantana’s client, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s (CDC’s) National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN).
A successful candidate will:
Conduct analyses in SAS, interpret, summarize, and present findings to relevant stakeholders.
Manipulate datasets, conduct statistical analysis, and perform quality checks on analytic deliverables. Collaborate in planning, development, and implementation of projects and materials.
Communicate analytic advice and statistical methodology effectively with clients, management, and staff.
Analyze and understand client needs and translate them into formal requirements.
Provide results to the project team and clients both verbally and in writing. Results should be reported in an appropriate manner for the audience – i.e., some reports will be highly technical while other reports will be written in plain language.
Exhibit attention to detail and critical thinking when performing data quality checks, developing materials, reviewing documentation, troubleshooting issues, and reporting results.
Collaborate and coordinate effectively with multidisciplinary team members to achieve programmatic goals.
Participate in development of business requirements using industry standards.
Take part in application testing and provide feedback to software developers and quality assurance technicians.
Interpret and explain basic analytics methodologies and results to end users.
Maintain public health expertise; stay abreast of industry changes and trends.
Develop and deliver trainings, project updates, and presentations on Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s (CDC’s) National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN) work.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in statistics, epidemiology, public health, or related discipline
6 years of relevant experience
Experience using SAS to import data, manipulate data/datasets, and conduct analyses relating to evaluation of data quality and accuracy
Experience managing large datasets; moving and merging data files from different platforms cleaning and aggregating data and performing quality control
Ability to attain Public Trust Clearance
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree in relevant field
Experience with national surveillance datasets
Knowledge and/or experience with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s (CDC) National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN) or other public health entity
Knowledge and/or experience with surveillance in post-acute care settings

Additional Job Information:
This position is 100% work-from-home/remote apart from the annual Lantana Retreat, held as conditions allow.
Lantana is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants for current openings will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or native origin.
For this position, we are not accepting applicants outside of the United States.
